title: renault_ft
body:
The Renault FT, also referred to as FT-17 and FT17, was a French light [[tank]] that was among the most revolutionary and influential tank designs in history. The FT was the first production tank to have its armament within a fully rotating turret. The Renault FT's configuration – crew compartment at the front, engine compartment at the back, and main armament in a revolving turret – became and remains the standard tank layout.

h4. See also

title: washboard
body:
A washboard is a tool designed for hand washing clothing. The use of washboards have fallen out of use in the developed world, where [[washing_machine|washing machines]] have become common. For the developing world, washboards may still be a common sight. In some parts of the United States washboards are used as a musical instrument.

A washboard works by rubbing wet clothing against its corrugated or ridged side.  This helps to remove dirt from the clothing through abrasion.  If soap is used, the rubbing action helps to drive soap through the clothing and allows the soap to carry dirt away.

title: ole_tower
body:
[b]Over Legend Endless Tower[/b] (Abbreviated as [i]Ole Tower[/i]) is a Japanese webgame developed by SE Mobile and Online Co.Ltd.

The main purpose of the game is to build an "endless" tower using different "tool girls" (Kenhime) at your disposal. The game also includes a combat system in a phase-by-phase and turn-based fashion, similar to many other games on DMM including [[Kantai Collection]].

The game has gained popularity with a moderate amount of [[Kantai Collection]] fans due to the obvious similarity.

h4. Characters

* [[Demolition Machine (ole tower)|]]
* [[Hammer (ole tower)|]]
* [[Mini Excavator (ole tower)|]]
* [[Rammer (ole tower)|]]
* [[Stand Floodlight (ole tower)|]]
* [[Water Pump Pliers (ole tower)|]]
* [[Wheel Loader (ole tower)|]]

title: logan_(movie)
body: Logan is a 2017 American superhero film starring [[Hugh Jackman]] as the titular character. It is the tenth film in the [[X-Men film series]] and the third and final installment in the Wolverine trilogy, following [[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]] (2009) and [[The Wolverine]] (2013). The film, which takes inspiration from the "Old Man Logan" comics storyline by Mark Millar and Steve McNiven, follows an aged [[Wolverine (x-men)|]] and an extremely ill [[Charles Xavier]] who must defend a young mutant named [[x-23|Laura]] from the Reavers led by [[Donald Pierce]] and Zander Rice.

title: pokemon_horizons
body:
The eighth series of the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]]. It succeeds [i][[pokemon journeys|Pokémon Journeys: The Series]][/i]. It premiered on April 14, 2023 in Japan with a one-hour special, and on March 7, 2024 in the United States. 

The series features dual protagonists [[Liko (pokemon)|]] and [[Roy (pokemon)|]], who join together with a group of adventurers known as the Rising Volt Tacklers and set out to travel the Pokémon world with them, visiting all the regions introduced in the core series from Kanto to Paldea. Liko also finds herself targeted by the mysterious Explorers organization, which is after her equally mysterious pendant.

title: alternative_girls
body:
A mobile gacha game published by CyberAgent. The player takes the role of the Captain and is tasked with training and advising the Alterna, schoolgirls who protect humans from hostile Night Beasts.

One of the most notable features was allowing the player to experience certain scenes with the Alterna in VR, including character and event stories, karaoke, and lying in bed with them.

The online version ended service on January 4, 2022, and was converted to an offline version the next day.

title: ocean_sunfish
body:
Common name for the [i]Molidae[/i] family of fishes, also commonly known as Ocean Sunfishes.

Their body shape comes to an end just behind the dorsal and anal fins, giving them a "half-fish" appearance. 

The most Famous members of this family is the Ocean Sunfish ([i]Mola Mola[/i]) and the Southern Sunfish ([i]Mola Alexandrini[/i]).

This tag will also apply for freshwater sunfish in the family, Centrarchidae.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Ocean Sunfish":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mola_(fish)]
* "Wikipedia -  Freshwater Sunfish":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrarchidae]

title: hotchkiss_h39
body:
The H35 was a French light [[tank]] developed prior to [[World War II]]. Despite having been designed from 1933 as a rather slow but well-armoured light infantry support tank, the type was initially rejected by the French Infantry because it proved difficult to steer while driving cross-country, and was instead adopted in 1936 by the French Cavalry.

title: andou_(girls_und_panzer)
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]] and introduced in [[girls_und_panzer_saishuushou|Das Finale]].

Tank commander of an [[Somua s35]] and vice-commander of the [[france|French]]-themed "BC Freedom Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

She is based off of [[Andre Grandier]] from the series [[Versailles no Bara]].

Her full name is [b]Andou Rena[/b] (安藤 レナ)[あんどう れな].

Voiced by [[Tsuda Minami]]  "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Das Finale

Leader of the Examination student group of the BC Freedom Academy tankery team. She ridicules the students of the Escalator group as "greenhouse-raised" who cannot fight as they have not won the examination war. In the match, she is the commander of an S35.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: somua_s35
body:
The S35 was a French Cavalry [[tank]] of [[World War II]]. Built from 1936 until 1940 to equip the armoured divisions of the Cavalry, it was for its time a relatively agile medium-weight tank, superior in armour and armament to its French and foreign competitors, such as the contemporary versions of the German [[Panzer III]]. It was constructed from well-sloped, mainly cast, armour sections, that however made it expensive to produce and time-consuming to maintain.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* "External Link - Wikipedia: S35":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SOMUA_S35

title: kawashima_momo
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Gunner and loader of Team [[Turtle]] in a [[Panzer 38(t)]] ([tn]later upgraded to a [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)]][/tn]) on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team. Also the Public Relations Manager of the student council. Is made the overall commander for [i]Das Finale[/i].

Her name means [[peach]], and is fruit-based like the other members of the student council.

Voiced by [[Ueda Kana]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

Runs public relations for the Ooarai Girls Academy student council. Supports the shenanigans of the president. Is a senior.

[tn]Source: post #1291295[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Is Team Turtle's loader, gunner, and radio operator. Despite her constant condescending attitude, she's actually weak in a pinch and will panic right away. Faithful to the President, during the crisis of the second school closing, she was viewed as conducting herself in an admirable way as a substitute for the President.  Although in charge of the gunnery, her aim is shockingly terrible.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: marder_iii
body:
The [b]Marder III[/b] is the name for a type of [[World War II]] German [[self-propelled artillery]] used as [[tank]] destroyers and built on the chassis of a [[Panzer 38(t)]] tank. 

The German word [i]Marder[/i] means "marten" in English. They were in production from 1942 to 1944 and served with the [[Wehrmacht]] on all fronts until the end of the war.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Marder III":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marder_III

title: koyama_yuzu
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Driver of Team [[Turtle]] in a [[Panzer 38(t)]] ([tn]later upgraded to a [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)]][/tn]) on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.. Also Vice President of the student council.

Her name is based on the citrus fruit [[yuzu (fruit)|yuzu]], and is fruit-based like the other members of the student council.

Voiced by [[Takahashi Mikako]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

The gentle Vice President of the Student Council. It feels like she's being manipulated quite a bit by the President and Kawashima. Everyone admires her big boobs. Is a senior.

[tn]Source: post #1283992[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Team Turtle's driver. Former Student Council Vice President. A competent right-hand, she fills in on the management of the Student Council for Anzu who usually does nothing. With a suprising aptitude for maneuvering tanks, in the Pravda battle of the 63rd Tournament she outmaneuvered a large amount of T-34 tanks, helping to destroy their enemies with point-blank firings.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: kadotani_anzu
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Tank commander, radio operator, occasional gunner, and leader of Team [[Turtle]] in a [[Panzer 38(t)]] ([tn]later upgraded to a [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)]][/tn]) on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team. Also the President of the student council.

Her name means [[apricot]], and is fruit-based like the other members of the student council.

Voiced by [[Fukuen Misato]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

President of the Ooarai Girls Academy student council. She's short, but is generally lighthearted about it. She's the perpetrator in drawing Miho into Tankery.  Is a senior.

[tn]Source: post #1283992[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Boards the Hetzer (38(t)) as the tank commander. Former Student Council President. Used an overbearing method to draw Miho back into Tankery after she had transferred schools to distance herself from it. Although somewhat coercive in her doings, she cares about the school more than anything else. Likes dried potatoes.

[tn]Source: "[1]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: panzer_38(t)
body:
Originally a Czech tank of pre-World War II design. After Czechoslovakia was taken over by Germany, it was adopted by the German Army, seeing service in the invasions of Poland, France and Russia. Production ended in 1942, when its armament was deemed inadequate. In all, over 1400 were manufactured. The chassis continued to be produced for [[Marder III]] (1942-1944) and [[jagdpanzer_38(t)|Hetzer]] (1944-1945) tank destroyers, turretless assault guns, anti-tank guns and anti-aircraft guns.

The (t) stands for [i]tschechisch[/i], the German word for Czech; the Czechoslovak military designation was LT vz. 38. Manufacturer's designations included TNH series, TNHPS, LTP and LTH). The special vehicle designation for the tank in Germany was Sd.Kfz. 140.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Panzer 38(t)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_38%28t%29
* GuP Website "Panzerkampfwagen 38(t)":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_38t.html

body:

title: waifu2x
body:
[i]Single-Image Super-Resolution for Anime-Style Art using Deep Convolutional Neural Networks.[/i]

An [[upscaled|upscaling]] and [[noise reduction]] algorithm specifically designed to work on 2D anime-style art.

Like any other form of [[third-party edit|third-party]] [[upscaled|upscaling]], third-party Waifu2X upscales are only accepted if the original version is not available, and should be flagged/deleted if the original picture is uploaded.

If you want to upload a picture that has gone through Waifu2X, follow [[help:image source]] for instructions on how to try and find the original picture first, and only upload the upscaled version if reverse searching fails.

h4. See also

* [[image sample]]
* [[resized]]

h4. External links

* Online demo application: https://www.waifu2x.net/

title: megatron
body:
[b]Megatron[/b] is one of the most well-known villains of the [[Transformers]] franchise. He is the powerful and merciless leader of the antagonist faction, the evil [[Decepticon]]s.

His original alternate mode is a grey and silver [[Walther P38]] [[handgun]] with several attachments. His vehicular mode varies in each depiction, but he usually transforms into a [[military]] vehicle. Notably as [[M1 Abrams]] main battle tank in the [[transformers (live action)|live action movie]].

Megatron's first G1 design was created by designer Ohno Kouhjin for the [i]Diaclone[/i] japanese [[transformation]] [[robot]] [[toy]] series in the early 80s.

[quote]Motto: [i]"Peace through tyranny...!!!"[/i][/quote]

h1. Alternate Versions
* Galvatron - [spoilers]the upgraded form [[Unicron]] gives to Megatron in the G1 movie, and the name used for his upgraded form in several later series as well. As[/spoilers] Galvatron is sometimes depicted as a completely separate character, at times existing alongside Megatron, images of Galvatron alone should not be tagged as [[Megatron]].
* [[Optimal Megatron]]  - Megatron's upgraded form in [[Beast Machines]].
* [[Gigatron]] - The Decepticon leader in [[Transformers Car Robots|Car Robots]], who was renamed to Megatron in the English dub.
* [[Megatron (IDW)]] - the [[the transformers (idw)|IDW Comics]] depiction of Megatron, most notable for his sincere attempts at atonement and defection to the [[Autobot|Autobots]].
* [[Megatron (Prime)]] - the depiction of Megatron in [[Transformers Prime]], with a design inspired by his appearance in the [[transformers (live action)|live action films]].
* [[Megatron (Shattered Glass)]] - the depiction of Megatron in the [[transformers shattered glass|Shattered Glass]] AU, in which he is the noble leader of the benevolent [[decepticon|Decepticons]].
* [[Megatron (Kotobukiya Bishoujo)]] -  a [[humanization|humanized]] [[genderswap (mtf)|female]] version of Megatron from the [[Kotobukiya Bishoujo]] figure line.

h4. See also

* [spoilers][[Galvatron]][/spoilers]
* [[Megatron (Beast Wars)]] - The [[Predacon]] leader in [[Beast Wars]], transforms into a [[tyrannosaurus rex]].

title: erina_batch
body:
A character from [[GALZOO Island]], who serves as [[Leopold Maala]]'s arch-rival and adoptive sister. 

Throughout the game, she will attempt to capture and tame any Gal Monsters not captured by Leopold, and will succeed in doing so if Leopold takes too long. To illustrate this, she is always guaranteed to capture and tame a [[Tenten (Alicesoft)|]], who becomes her accomplace.

Additionally, Erina also makes a cameo in [[Sengoku Rance]], serving as a bonus unit after completing the game once.

title: rance_iii
body:
The third game in the [[Rance (series)|]] series, released for the [[PC-98 (computer)|]] in 1991. It is notable for introducing many settings and concepts that would become staples of the Rance universe, including Dark Lords, the Helman Empire, and expanding on the Kingdom of Leazas.

It received a remake for [[Microsoft Windows]] platforms, titled [[Rance 03]], in 2015.

title: neopet_(creature)
body:
The titular [[creature]]s that inhabit [[Neopets]]. They come in many colors, that can be applied to a pet using a paintbrush or other specific methods such as a morphing potion or the lab ray.

Neopets range in degree of sentience - most named characters are [[furry|anthropomorphic]], while the player's Neopets are treated more similarly to actual pets.

title: amiya_aranha_(2nd_costume)
body:
The 2nd/rockstar [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Amiya Aranha]].

This appearance is an [[emo fashion]]-styled look consisting of a [[torn shirt|torn]] [[black shirt|black]] [[print shirt]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[see-through skirt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform footwear]] with [[torn socks|torn]] [[black socks|black]] [[fishnet socks]]. Her accessories include a [[detached collar]], [[striped sleeves|striped]] [[detached sleeves]] worn [[sleeves past wrists|past her wrists]], [[bandaged leg|bandages on her left leg]] and a single [[o-ring thigh strap]] connected to a [[garter straps|garter strap]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]] in this costume, it features [[multiple hairpins]] and a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] pinning her bangs to the side and exposing her [[forehead]], revealing that she has a hidden [[extra eyes|second set of eyes]], which have [[black sclera]]. She also wears [[nail polish]] in the appearance, with [[black nails|black fingernails]] and [[toenail polish|toenails]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6301838

title: stole_something_outrageous
body:
[quote]
[[zenigata_kouichi|Zenigata]]: "くそぉ、一足遅かったか。ルパンめ、まんまと盗みおって!" (Blast it! I was one step behind him. Lupin managed to steal something again!)
[[clarisse_de_cagliostro|Clarisse]]: "いいえ、あの方は何も盗らなかったわ。わたくしのために戦って下さったんです" (No, he didn't steal anything. All he did was fight for me.)
[[zenigata_kouichi|Zenigata]]: "いえ、奴はとんでもないものを盗んでいきました" (No, he stole something precious[outrageous]...)
[[zenigata_kouichi|Zenigata]]: "あなたの心です" (Your heart.)

[/quote]

Well-known dialogue from the ending of [[Castle of Cagliostro]].

[[Marisa stole the precious thing]] is a [[parody]] that inspired parodies of its own.

title: good_burger
body:
[b]Good Burger[/b] is a 1997 teen comedy movie starring Kenan Thompson and Kel Mitchell. The movie is based on the "Good Burger" sketch from the [[Nickelodeon]] variety series All That.

The movie follows Dexter Reed(Kenan) a teenage slacker who is forced to get a summer job after crashing his teacher's car in order to pay for the damages. He later works at the Good Burger restaurant, where he befriends Ed(Kel), a dimwitted but well-meaning cashier. When the new rival Mondo Burger restaurant threatens to drive Good Burger out of business, Dexter and Ed work together to save their restaurant.

Despite mixed reviews, the movie was well liked by fans which the movie continues to have a cult following. A sequel, titled [b]Good Burger 2[/b] was released in 2023 on Paramount+ with Kenan and Kel reprising their roles.

title: saesee_tiin
body: Character from [[Star Wars]], Saesee Tiin, a Force-sensitive Iktotchi male from the moon Iktotch, was a [[Jedi]] Master who served on the Jedi High Council during the last years of the Galactic Republic. A skilled lightsaber combatant and starfighter pilot, Tiin fought in the Clone Wars as a Jedi General of the Grand Army of the Republic. He and Agen Kolar were slain by Darth Sidious and became the first victims of the Great Jedi Purge shortly before fellow Jedi Master Kit Fisto when a team of High Council members, organized by [[Mace Windu]] who was betrayed by [[Anakin Skywalker]] shortly before Darth Sidious killed Windu as well, confronted the Sith Lord, who was revealed to be the true identity of Supreme Chancellor Palpatine, who would proceed to destroy the Jedi Order.

title: luminara_unduli
body: Character from [[Star Wars]], Luminara Unduli was a Force-sensitive Mirialan female [[Jedi]] Master during the final days of the Jedi Order.

title: kit_fisto
body: Character from [[Star Wars]], Kit Fisto was a Force-sensitive Nautolan male [[Jedi]] Master during the final years of the Galactic Republic. Fisto was known as an expert swordsman, possessing some of the finest dueling skills in the Jedi Order. A celebrated fighter, Fisto served as a Jedi General of the Grand Army of the Republic during the Clone Wars, a galaxy-wide conflict between the Republic and Confederacy of Independent Systems. He fought in various campaigns and over the course of the war, was accepted as a member of the Jedi High Council.

title: evan_peters
body:
Evan Thomas Peters (born January 20, 1987) is an American actor. He made his acting debut in the 2004 drama film Clipping Adam and starred in the ABC science fiction series Invasion from 2005 to 2006.
Peters gained wide recognition for playing multiple roles over ten seasons in Ryan Murphy's FX anthology series American Horror Story, from 2011 to 2021. His performance as a detective in the HBO crime miniseries Mare of Easttown (2021) won him a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor. For portraying the titular character in Murphy's Netflix miniseries Dahmer – Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story (2022), he won a Golden Globe Award for Best Actor and was nominated for a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor.

In film, Peters has played a supporting role in the superhero film [[Kick-Ass]] (2010), and [[Peter Maximoff]] / [[Quicksilver]] in the [[X-Men film series]] (2014–2019). He also received a nomination for the BIFA Award for Best Supporting Actor for playing a rebellious student in the heist film American Animals (2018).

title: aaron_taylor-johnson
body: Aaron Perry Taylor-Johnson (né Johnson; born 13 June 1990) is an English actor. He is known for his portrayal of the title character in [[Kick-Ass]] (2010) and its 2013 sequel, as well as the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] character [[Pietro Maximoff]] in [[Avengers: Age of Ultron]] (2015).

title: iceman_(x-men)
body: Iceman (Robert Louis "Bobby" Drake) is a superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] and is a founding member of the [[X-Men]]. Created by writer Stan Lee and artist/co-plotter Jack Kirby, the character first appeared in The X-Men #1 (Sept. 1963). Iceman is a mutant born with superhuman abilities. He has the ability to manipulate ice and cold by freezing water vapor around him. This allows him to freeze objects, as well as cover his body with ice.

title: alien_(series)
body:
An action/horror [[science fiction]] media franchise produced by [[20th Century Studios]]. 

The original [[Alien (1979)|1979 film]] follows [[Ellen Ripley]] and her encounters with the [[Xenomorph]]s. The success of the first film spawned a media franchise of novels, comic books, [[video game]]s, and toys, as well as three sequel and three prequel films, and the story of her character Ripley's encounters with the Alien creatures became the thematic thread that ran through the sequel [[Aliens (1986)|]] (1986), [[Alien 3]] (1992) and [[Alien Resurrection]] (1997). 

The subsequent prequels [[Alien vs. Predator]] (2004) and Alien vs. Predator: Requiem (2007) abandoned this theme in favor of a crossover with the [[Predator (1987)|]] franchise.

h4. Franchise Inspired by Alien:
* [[Berserk]]
* [[Blame!]]
* [[Dragon Ball]] ([[3rd form Frieza]])
* [[Metroid]]
* [[Iria Zeiram the Animation]]
* Lily C.A.T.
* [[Scorn]]

h4. See also
* [[H.R. Giger]]

title: alien_(1979)
body:
[quote][i]In space, no one can hear you scream...[/i] - Main tagline.[/quote]

[b]Alien[/b] is a 1979 [[science fiction]] [[horror (theme)|]] film. It is directed by Ridley Scott and stars Tom Skerritt, Sigourney Weaver, Veronica Cartwright, Harry Dean Stanton, John Hurt, Ian Holm and Yaphet Kotto. The film is the first of the [[Alien (series)|]] franchise.

The film's title refers to its primary antagonist: a highly lethal [[alien]] monster that attacks the crew of a [[spacecraft]].

Dan O'Bannon wrote the screenplay from a story by him and Ronald Shusett, drawing influence from previous works of science fiction and horror. The film was produced through Brandywine Productions and distributed by 20th Century Fox, with producers David Giler and Walter Hill making significant revisions and additions to the script. The titular [[xenomorph|Alien]] and its accompanying elements were designed by Swiss surrealist artist [[H.R. Giger]], while concept artists Moebius, Ron Cobb and Chris Foss designed the human aspects of the film.

title: mecha
body:
[b]Mecha[/b] (メカ - [i]me-ka[/i]) are giant [[robot]]s, robot vehicles, robot construction equipment, robot mobile buildings and generally over-sized robot machines. While the original Japanese definition extends to include power armor, exoskeletons, and general sci-fi machinery, for danbooru purposes this tag is for piloted and/or giant robots.

Primarily seen in [[science fiction]] settings, though there are several cases of them in [[fantasy]] settings.

h4. Types of Mecha
* [[Externally piloted mecha]] - A mecha where the controls are external and the pilot rides on top of the machine.
* [[Walker (robot)|]] - A type of walking mecha that usually lacks arms.
* [[Super Robot]] - Mecha with super powers. 
* "Real Robot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha_anime_and_manga#Real_robot (リアルロボット [i]Riaru Robotto[/i]) anime genre started by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]'s [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] in the late [[1970s_(Style)|70s]] and early [[1980s_(style)|80s]]. [[Realistic]] manned mecha similar in function to a humanoid bipedal [[tank]].

h4. Series-specific Tags
* [[Arm Slave (mecha)|]] ([[Full Metal Panic!]])
* [[Armored Trooper]] ([[Soukou Kihei VOTOMS]])
* [[AT-AT]] ([[Star Wars]])

** [[Man Machine]] ([[Gaia Gear]])
** [[Mobile Armor]] ([[Gundam]])

* [[Variable Fighter]] ([[Macross]])


h4. Other Related tags

* [[Exoskeleton]] - Small, external mechanical attachments that tends to be worn rather than piloted. Some may qualify for the mecha tag, though it should be judged on a case by case basis.
* [[Power armor]] - Full body mechanical armor that usually augments the wearer's abilities.
* [[Robot animal]] - Robot in the shape of an animal, sometimes overlaps with mecha in series such as [[Zoids]] and certain [[Super Sentai]] entries.
* [[Robot dragon]] - Robot in the shape of a dragon, often overlaps with mecha due to their size.

title: anmitsu_(dessert)
body:
A popular Japanese [[dessert]] consisting of small [[jelly cube|cubes]] of [[agar]] jelly dissolved with [[water]] or [[fruit]] [[juice]]. It is served in a [[bowl]] with sweet azuki bean paste or anko (the [i]an[/i] part of [i]anmitsu[/i]), boiled peas, and a variety of fruits such as [[peach]] slices, mikan, pieces of [[pineapple]]s, and [[cherry|cherries]]. The anmitsu usually comes with a small pot of sweet black syrup, or mitsu (the [i]mitsu[/i] part of [i]anmitsu[/i]) which one pours onto the jelly before eating.

h4.See also

* [[Mitsumame]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: kishido_temma
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber]] and member of [[Holostars]] from the second batch, [[SunTempo]]. Designed by [[Shiramine (srmn09)|]].

He has a princely appearance with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. While his model has him as a rather slender man, he's strong enough to [[princess carry]] his [[Astel Leda|genmate]] around or carry [[Kageyama Shien]] on his shoulders, and he also has a black belt in [[karate]].

Has a pet named [[Hiyamaru]] (ひや丸) who is a 2-year-old female [[ferret]], and a [[greatsword]] called "Tenken Yozora".

title: hanasaki_miyabi_(5th_costume)
body:
The fifth [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Holostars]]' [[Hanasaki Miyabi]], revealed as part of his 100,000 subscribers milestone celebration. It is inspired by [[Little Red Riding Hood]] and comes as a pair with [[Kishido Temma]]’s [[Kishido Temma (4th Costume)|fourth costume]] due to their shared fantasy theme and being revealed on the same day. 

This outfit includes a [[hooded cloak|hooded]] [[red cloak]] with [[floral print]] and [[gold trim]], and fixed with a [[yellow bow]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] worn with [[bolo tie]], [[green vest]], [[green pants|green]] [[pinstripe pants]], [[brown belt]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[lace-up boots]]. Attached to his belt are a [[book holster]] and a [[holstered]] [[handgun]]. He wears a [[thigh strap]], [[leaf hair ornament|leaf]] [[hairclip]] and [[glasses]] with [[eyewear strap]]. 
He has [[braided bangs]] in this costume. There’s also a [[stuffed wolf]] on his shoulder called "Lupin". 

This outfit has an [[alternate color]] variation where his [[white hair|hair]] and [[white cloak|cloak]] turns white, originated from a "tweet":[https://twitter.com/miyabihanasaki/status/1673237565972054017] showing the color change due to a bug in his model. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #5221336

title: 2024_pokemon_teraleak
body:
On 13 October 2024, Game Freak suffered a leak which revealed over a terabyte of data and information about [[Pokemon]].

The contents of the leak that are relevant to Danbooru include:
* Several [[prototype design]]s for Pokémon from [[pokemon rse|RSE]] to [[pokemon bw|BW]].
* "Mythologically-themed stories":[https://tcrf.net/Development:Pok%C3%A9mon_Diamond_and_Pearl/Documents] which feature [[pokephilia|relations between humans and Pokémon]], including [[Octillery]], [[Typhlosion]], and [[Slaking]].
* Profiles for several NPCs, notably referring to [[Skyla (pokemon)|]] as a "sexy pilot" and Hispanic.

title: unebi_(cruiser)
body:
A Japanese protected cruiser built in France. Launched in late 1886, it mysteriously disappeared on its maiden voyage to Japan with the loss of all hands aboard the ship. Because of the ship's disappearance, the Japanese never worked with French shipyards again and instead entrusted itself to British shipyards.
h4. External links

title: hiryuu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Hiryuu[/i], voiced by [[Ishigami Shizuka]].

h4. Appearance
In both base and retrofit forms, she has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[rabbit ears]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her [[flight deck]] is attached to one side while she launches her planes as [[hanafuda]] cards.

In her base form, she wears blue-colored [[Japanese clothes]] mixed with a modern [[blue skirt]] and a red belt with an anchor attached. She also wears regular white [[socks]], heeled shoes, and a [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on her right hand.

For her retrofit form, see her [[Hiryuu (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]


h4. History
In real life, she was conceived as an improved [[Souryuu (Azur Lane)|]] design to correct the seakeeping issues of the latter. Her island was located on the port side, one of the only two carriers in history (alongside [[Akagi (Azur Lane)|]]) with that configuration.

Her aviators were primarily responsible for the sinking of [[Arizona (Azur Lane)|]] in Pearl Harbor.

In the [[battle of Midway]], she was the only one out of four spared the onslaught of the American dive bombers in the morning strike, trailing them on the way to the US carriers, where her aviators crippled [[Yorktown (Azur Lane)|]]. A later afternoon strike finally put her out of action, and she was later scuttled with her Carrier Division commander [[Yamaguchi Tamon]] choosing to go down with her (although references to Tamon-maru are almost none in her Azur Lane incarnation).

h4. Skins

title: hatakaze_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class destroyer [i]Hatakaze[/i] in [[Azur Lane]], first released in the Crimson Echoes event of January 2019.

In-game, she is shown bespectacled, having [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into [[twintails]] and possessing [[animal ears]]. She also wears traditional [[Japanese clothes]] ([[kimono]] top and [[yellow skirt]]) and [[black socks|black]] printed [[kneehighs]]. She is also shown holding an [[omamori]].
Her rig contains two 12 cm single mounts and two 53.3 cm twin torpedo tubes, one gun and torpedo mount per side.

Historically, her advanced age meant that like her other sisters, she was relegated to escort duties, only seeing frontline action in the battle of the Sunda Strait in early 1942.
She was sunk by aircraft from [[Ticonderoga (Azur Lane)|]] and other US carriers in Kaohsiung after escorting one of these convoys in January 1945.

title: chappell_roan
body:
Kayleigh Rose Amstutz, known professionally as Chappell Roan, is an American singer and songwriter. Working with collaborator Dan Nigro, the majority of her music is inspired by 1980s synth-pop and early 2000s pop hits. Her aesthetic is heavily influenced by [[drag queen]]s, and her music and performing style have been described as "campy".

For the person, see [[Chappell Roan (person)]].

title: flower_tact
body:
In [[Heartcatch Precure!]], they are the wands used by the Pretty Cures to purify the Desertrian monsters of the week. The Tacts are individually named after their owners, but together are called Flower Tacts. Only [[Cure Sunshine]] doesn't have a Flower Tact - she uses the [[Shiny Tambourine (heartcatch Precure!)|]] instead.

* [[Cure Blossom]] uses the Blossom Tact for Pink Forte Wave, Floral Power Fortissimo (with Marine) and Shining Fortissimo (with Marine and Sunshine)

* [[Cure Marine]] uses the Marine Tact for Blue Forte Wave, Floral Power Fortissino (with Blossom) and Shining Fortissimo (with Blossom and Sunshine)

* [[Cure Moonlight]] uses the Moon Tact for Silver Forte Wave and a solo version of Floral Power Fortissimo

* [[Dark Precure]] uses the Dark Tact for Dark Forte Wave and Dark Power Fortissimo

title: hammann_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the destroyer [i]Hammann[/i], most famous for sinking alongside [i]Yorktown[/i] during the Battle of Midway.

She is a [[white_hair|white-haired]] girl with [[blue eyes]] and an [i]extremely[/i] [[tsundere]] personality, constantly referring to the [[Commander  (azur lane)|]] as a pervert. She is also highly protective of [[Yorktown (azur_lane)|]] and sometimes finds herself subject to pranks launched by her sister. Curiously for an American destroyer in the game, she is dressed as a [[maid]] and her retrofit further emphasizes this, though she bears no apparent relation to the Royal Maids such as [[Belfast (azur_lane)|]] or [[Sirius (azur_lane)|]]. Furthermore, while her [[cat ears]] bear resemblance to ships belonging to the Sakura Empire, they are [[fake animal ears]] in a [[headband]].

title: funeral_of_the_dead_butterflies
body:
An [[List Of Project Moon characters|abnormality]] in the [[Project Moon]] universe, first appearing in [[Lobotomy Corporation]].

It takes a humanoid form with a [[white butterfly]] in place of a [[animal head|head]] and has [[extra arms|five arms]]. It wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black coat]] over a [[black vest|black]] [[waistcoat]] and [[white shirt]], with its fifth arm, protruding from the neck, instead having a [[white sleeves|white sleeve]], along with [[black pants|black]] [[dress pants]] and [[black footwear|matching]] [[dress shoes]]. It is often seen [[carrying]] a [[coffin]] with a [[white butterfly]] engraved on it with two of its hind arms.

Its associated [[E.G.O (project moon)|]] is [[Solemn Lament (e.g.o)|]].

title: magia_baiser_(la_verita)
body:
Magia Baiser's La Verita transformation she unlocked during her battle with [[Tada Randa]]. Her horns go from sprouting from the sides of her head to coming out of her forehead, and change color from white to a dark color. In addition, they go from looking like typical demon horns to looking like spider legs. Her costume is replaced with a cut-apart leotard with coattails and other embellishments vaguely reminiscent of a circus ringmaster or stage magician, most significantly a voluminous cape hanging like a curtain off a metal ring floating above her shoulders.

Not to be mistaken with her excited state in which she appears older with long hair and horns pointing straight up.

He's best known for character design and illustrations for the video game company Softmax. His art is behind [[the War of Genesis]] and [[Magna Carta]] titles. His favorite designer is [[Murata Range]]. He is also multilingual, able to speak Korean, English, and Japanese. title: winter_daphne
body:
[b][i]Daphne odora[/i][/b] (lit. fragrant daphne) is a species of [[flower]]ing [[bush|shrub]] of the genus [i]Daphne[/i] in the family [i]Thymelaeaceae[/i], native to Asia. Commonly called winter daphne, it is known for its showy, fragrant flowers. It blooms in mid to late winter, as the common name suggests.

Winter daphne flowers grow in clusters, usually at the end of stems surrounded by leaves. The flowers have four pointed petals, with two upper petals overlapping the two lower petals; the petals are actually tepals (undifferentiated petals and sepals). The flowers are creamy white and pink to purple, usually whitish or pinkish on the inside and pink to purple on the outside. Although rare, the plant sometimes produces berries after flowering. All parts of the plant are poisonous, especially the berries.

h4. Examples
* !asset #23768396
* !post #4243170
* !post #4426380

h4. See also
* [[Gold osmanthus]]
* [[Hydrangea]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Daphne odora":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daphne_odora
* "Wikipedia: Daphne (plant)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daphne_(plant)
* "Wikipedia: Thymelaeaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thymelaeaceae

title: ki-adi-mundi
body: Ki-Adi-Mundi is a character from [[Star Wars]], he was a Cerean [[Jedi]] Master and a leading member of the Jedi High Council during the last years of the Galactic Republic. By the time of the Clone Wars, Mundi became a Jedi General of the Grand Army of the Republic. Like his Jedi colleagues, he led the Republic clone troopers against the Separatist Alliance forces in several battles across the galaxy, including the first and second Battles of [[Geonosis]] and the Outer Rim Sieges. During the final year of the Clone Wars, Mundi oversaw the Republic invasion of Mygeeto with the Galactic Marines under his command. During the campaign, Supreme Chancellor [[palpatine|Sheev Palpatine]] instructed the Grand Army soldiers to execute their Jedi leaders per Order 66, an act that resulted in the death of Mundi along with the majority of the Jedi Order.

title: barriss_offee
body:
Character from [[Star Wars]], Barriss Offee is a Mirialan [[Jedi]] apprentice of Luminara Unduli and a close friend of [[Ahsoka Tano]]. She later betrays Ahsoka and frames her for a terrorist bombing after she becomes disillusioned with the Jedi Order's wartime policies. Offee is eventually unmasked and defeated by [[Anakin Skywalker]], resulting in her arrest.

The character has been portrayed by Nalini Krishan in Episode II, and voiced by Meredith Salenger in [[star wars: the clone wars|The Clone Wars]] and Tales of the Empire.

title: zabrak
body:
An alien race in the [[Star Wars]] universe, Zabraks were a near-human carnivorous species native to the planets Iridonia and Dathomir. Most members of the species had distinctive horns atop their heads, as well as two hearts. Although most Zabraks lived on Iridonia, some settled on the planet Dathomir, where the females of the species, known as Nightsisters, ruled over the Nightbrother males and practiced powerful dark side magick. Notably, female Dathomirian Zabraks had paler skin and lacked the cranial horns shared by the rest of the species.

Zabraks fought against the Galactic Empire's attempts to undermine and subvert them, and instead of surrendering, many joined the Alliance to Restore the Republic. Zabraks were considered to be proud, self-determined, and even arrogant to some, and they were one of the most independent species in the galaxy.

title: venator-class_star_destroyer
body:
A [[Star Wars]] spaceship.
The Venator-class Star Destroyer, also known as the Venator-class cruiser, was a class of more than 1,000 meter-long attack cruiser of the Star Destroyer design family that was operated by the navy of the Galactic Republic. Designed by Lira Wessex to feature a double-wedge design and perform a wide range of missions, the Venator was the first class of Star Destroyer to be manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards. Alternatively known as the Republic cruiser, Republic attack cruiser, or Republic Star Destroyer, it was a versatile capital ship capable of serving as both a combatant in ship-to-ship naval warfare and a starfighter carrier, while also being employed as a troop transport, cargo ship, and supply and replenishment vessel. As a warship, Venators were protected by powerful deflector shields and boasted a range of weaponry. For its carrier role, a large flight deck, along with hangars to accommodate a complement of starfighters, gunships, shuttles, armored vehicles and other craft, was contained in the forward section, while three more docking bays were located around the ship. At least two variants existed, the Venator I-class and the Venator II-class.

As the backbone of the Galactic Republic's navies during the Clone Wars, the Venator was commonly employed by the Jedi Generals of the Grand Army of the Republic as their flagships, thus earning the moniker of Jedi cruiser. Deployed across the galaxy against the Confederacy of Independent Systems, Venators saw action in many major engagements, such as the Battle of Christophsis, the Malevolence Campaign, the Battle of Ryloth, and the Second Battle of Geonosis. In the climactic Battle of Coruscant in the waning days of the war, over 1,000 Venators defended the galactic capital Coruscant against a massive Separatist fleet. Eventually, these starships emerged on the victors' side as icons of the conflict.

When the Republic ended with Darth Sidious's purge of the [[Jedi]] Order and his establishment of its successor, the Galactic Empire, the Venator-class Star Destroyers were absorbed into the nascent Imperial Navy. During the early Imperial Era, Venators were utilized to consolidate Imperial authority, and later they fought against Separatist holdouts and fledgling rebel cells. They were also assigned to the private fleets of Moffs, and to flight schools. Others were scrapped on planets like Bracca, where they were dismantled and salvaged by the Scrapper Guild. Although Venators were still active at the time of the Galactic Civil War, they had mostly been replaced by the Imperial-class Star Destroyer, a larger warship modeled on its Republic predecessor.

title: star_wars:_return_of_the_jedi
body:
[b]Return of The Jedi[/b] is the third installment in the original [[Star Wars]] film trilogy, the third film to be produced, and the sixth chronological order. The film was released in theaters on May 25, 1983. It grossed $374 million worldwide during its initial theatrical run, becoming the highest-grossing film of 1983. 

The film stars [[Mark Hamill]], [[Harrison Ford]], [[Carrie Fisher]], Billy Dee Williams, Anthony Daniels, David Prowse, Kenny Baker, Peter Mayhew and Frank Oz.

[[Luke Skywalker]] and friends travel to [[Tatooine]] to rescue their companion [[Han Solo]] from the vile [[Jabba the Hutt]]. The Empire prepares to crush the Rebellion with a more powerful [[Death Star]], while the Rebel fleet mounts a massive attack on the space station. Luke confronts his father, [[Darth Vader]], in a final climactic duel before the evil [[palpatine|Emperor]].

16 years after the release of Return of the Jedi, [[George Lucas]] wrote and directed the prequel trilogy, consisting of the films [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace|The Phantom Menace]], [[Star Wars: Attack of the Clones|Attack of the Clones]] and [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Revenge of the Sith]].

title: gun_gun_cut
body:
The scene cut during an [[Ultra Series|Ultra]]'s [[transformation|trans]][[henshin|formation]] which generally depicts them as rapidly growing larger with their [[outstretched arm|arm outstretched]]. Why this specific cut is known as a "gun gun cut" is not known, but the term has been used officially. Otherwise referred to as the 'Ultraman Rise' or 'Ultraman Rising' pose.

While most poses during the cut generally only have one arm outstretched, depending on the cut parodied, both arms can be outstretched, the hand can be in a number of poses (most commonly as a fist), and some later Ultras even have non-static poses during cuts. A select handful of Ultras do not raise their arms when transforming, whether in specific contexts or generally, such as [[Ultraseven]] using the [[Ultra Eye]].

The most commonly parodied version of the cut is [[Ultraman]]'s, with only one arm outstretched and his hand thrust into a fist.

h4. Examples

* !post #513120: From [i]Daikessen! Chou Ultra Hachi Kyoudai[/i]

h4. External links

* Pixpedia: "Gun Gun Cut":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%90%E3%82%93%E3%81%90%E3%82%93%E3%82%AB%E3%83%83%E3%83%88] (Japanese, features list of each Ultra's cut)
* YouTube: "All Ultraman Rise Sequence (1966 - 2024)":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KVOl7yQBZAA

title: klan_klein
body:
A fictional female [[alien]] character from the [[MACROSS]] series.

[b]Klan Klein[/b] is the [[Zentradi]] ([[Meltrandi]]) [[Queadluun-Rea]] [[mecha]] pilot and leader of the [[S.M.S.]] military's Pixie Team in [[Macross Frontier]]. 

She has the ability to transform between a [[giantess]] [[maclone]] form and human-sized [[miclone]] form, which she resembles a child due to a genetic defect.

title: mazda
body:
A Japanese [[car|automaker]] founded in 1920. Particularly notable for their usage of the rotary engine, the main engine used for their performance vehicles.

With the discontinuation of the RX-8 in 2012, Mazda did not produce any rotary cars until the 2023 MX-30, a plug-in hybrid crossover.

title: azuma_himari_(mato_seihei_no_slave)
body:
Character in [[Mato Seihei no Slave]]. Has [[yellow eyes]] and [[blue hair|blue]]-[[green hair|green]] [[long hair]] with part tied in [[hair rings]]. Usually wears the [[Anti-Demon Corps uniform]].

Member of the Mato Defense Corps 7th Division. Her Mato Peach ability, "Lofty Ambitions: [b]Learning[/b]," lets her copy others' Peach abilities to an extent depending on her compatibility with the techniques; her usual go-to is [[Tokoroyama Saki]]'s "[b]Bang Bang Bang[/b]," which turns her limbs and/or hair into weapons.

Not to be confused with the [[Azuma Himari (Saint Dorei Gakuen 2)|]] of [[Saint Dorei Gakuen 2]].

title: rabbit_pose
body:
A pose where a character holds both their hands up to the top of their head, fingers together and palm flat, to mimic the appearance of [[rabbit ears]]. Most commonly done as a cute or sexy gesture. Prominently featured in the [[meme]]tic [[Caramelldansen]] video and derivative images.

Not to be confused with [[bunny ears prank]], which is when a [[V]] sign is made behind someone's head for comical effect, such as during a photo.

title: g-code
body:
G-code (also called RS-274) is the most widely used computer numerical control (CNC) programming language. It is used mainly in computer-aided manufacturing to control automated machine tools, as well as for 3D-printer slicer applications. The G stands for geometry.

h4.External links

title: hero_(dq1)
body:
The hero of [i][[Dragon Quest I]][/i], descendant of [[Roto (dq3)|]]/Erdrick, vanquisher of the [[Dragon Lord]] and, along with [[Princess Laura]], the ancestor of the [[Dragon Quest II|DQ2]] heroes.

While his ancestor codified the very concept of a JRPG hero, he laid the foundations.

[Spoilers] In [[Dragon Quest Builders]], he appears as a boss. He takes the appearance of a [[hood_(dragon quest)|Hood]] with red clothing instead of green and a cape. [/spoilers]

body:

He is noted to bear a heavy resemblance to [[Doruton_(dqb2)|Doruton]] from the [[Dragon Quest Builders 2|game's sequel]].

title: matthew_patel
body:
[[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] character. [[Ramona Flowers]]'s first evil ex, having dated in the 7th grade. Somewhat of a [[chuunibyou]] - claims to have supernatural abilities. This turns out to be true. Can summon a group of female demons known as the [[Demon Hipster Chicks]] to fight for him.

He is a [[dark-skinned male]] of Indian descent with [[black hair|black]]/dark [[brown hair]] that [[hair over one eye|covers one eye]]. He usually dresses in an [[emo fashion|emo]] style.

A major antagonist in [[Scott Pilgrim Takes Off]], usurping [[Gideon Graves]] as the leader of the [[League of Evil Exes]]. He also gets an outfit upgrade as a result, wearing a [[suit]] with a [[red shirt]], [[black jacket]] and [[black necktie]].

[b]CV:[/b] Satya Bhabha (EN), Saito Shinji (JPN)

title: delinquent
body:
Depictions of various stereotypical "rebellious" and oftentimes outlaw youngsters, especially high school students of teenage years.

Delinquents have come in many types in different times and places, but the stereotype tends to attach itself to whatever scary new subculture they have come up with at that time: greasers in 1950s US, mods and rockers in 1960s Britain, [[punk]]s everywhere since the 1970s.

title: seiken_gakuin_no_maken_tsukai
body:
A light novel series written by "Yuu Shimizu":[https://twitter.com/shimizuMFJ] and illustrated by [[Toosaka Asagi]]. A manga adaptation illustrated by [[Keigen Hichou]] has been serialized in Kadokawa Shoten's shōnen manga magazine Monthly Shōnen Ace since November 2019 and an anime television series adaptation produced by Passione studio aired from October to December 2023. A RPG game was announced in April 2023.

English Title: [i]The Demon Sword Master of Excalibur Academy[/i]

h4. Synopsis

A thousand years ago, the Undead King, [[Leonis Death Magnus]], sealed his own body with a powerful barrier and cast a resurrection spell on himself. He shall rise again in one thousand years to conquer humanity for that is the mission given to him by the Goddess of Rebellion.

In the present time, a young girl named [[Riselia Ray Crystalia]] stumbled upon the ancient ruins of Leonis's mausoleum. Accidentally undoing the seal, Leonis awakens after his thousand-year slumber in the body of a ten-year-old human child. Mistaken to be a refugee of the Voids, Riselia takes Leonis into her care and Leonis begins his mission to uncover what has happened to the world while he slept.

title: sword_art_online
body:
A 2009-current light novel series written by "Kawahara Reki":[https://twitter.com/kunori] and illustrated by [[Bunbun]]. It has multiple manga adaptations, multiple videogames, a three season anime, and three movies.

The series takes place in the near future and focuses on protagonist [[Kirito]] and [[Asuna (sao)|]] as they play through various virtual reality MMORPG worlds.

Initially written in 2002 for the ASCII Media Works’ Dengeki Game Novel Prize (now Dengeki Novel Prize), the author refrained from sending it in due to exceeding the page limit.  Kawahara Reki published it as a web novel and later added 3 more volumes and short stories to the series.  After winning the Dengeki Novel Prize Grand Prize in 2008 for [[Accel World]], ASCII Media Works requested that aside from Accel World if they could also publish Sword Art Online as well. The author agreed and withdrew the web novel version. The series was republished in light novel format in 2009.

The series received an anime adaptation in 2012, which later became highly successful. And went on popularize a whole subgenre of Japanese media known as [[isekai]], which involves having the main character(s) originated from modern world being reincarnated into other worlds.

A movie, [[Sword Art Online the Movie: Ordinal Scale]], was released on February 18, 2017. The movie features a new original story that takes place some time after the second season of the anime.

A second movie, [[Sword Art Online Progressive]], was release on October 30, 2021. The movie retold the original story from the first two episodes of Aincrad Arc but through the perspective of [[Asuna (SAO)|]].

h4. Story arcs

* Aincrad (First Arc, SAO)
* Fairy Dance (Second Arc, ALO)
* Phantom Bullet (Third Arc, GGO)
* Caliburn / Mother's Rosario (Side Story Arcs, ALO)
* Ordinal Scale (OS)
* Alicization (Fourth Arc, Project Alicization)
* Unital Ring (Fifth Arc, UR)

title: glowworm_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the destroyer HMS [i]Glowworm[/i] (H92). 
Character design by [[Lino-Lin]], voiced by [[Igarashi Hiromi]]. 

Glowworm has [[very long hair|very long]] [[green hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with yellow scrunchies, and [[green eyes]]. 

Her outfit consists of a [[white dress|white]] [[frilled dress]] underlayer with [[long sleeves]], and a [[double-breasted]] [[red dress]] overlayer with [[gold trim]] and a [[breast cutout]]. She also has a purplish blue [[necktie]] and a [[maid headdress]] of the same maroon color as her overlayer. She has a purplish-blue [[thighhighs]] with ribbons around the trim, and [[mary janes]] of the same maroon color.

She wields an [[anchor]] with a green [[searchlight]] attached via a ribbon. 

h4. Skins 
* !post #2933616: Default
* !post #4342641: [[Glowworm (Jokey Adjudicator) (Azur Lane)|Jokey Adjudicator]]

Her skill "Meteor Slam" and several of her lines mention ramming, an allusion to when she rammed [[Admiral Hipper (azur lane)|Admiral Hipper]].

title: valstrax
body:
バルファルク (Barufaruku)

An elder dragon from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series, as well as one of the flagship monsters of [[Monster Hunter XX]]. Afterwards, it returned in [[Monster Hunter Rise]] as [[Crimson Glow Valstrax]].

Known as the "Sky Comet Dragon", Valstrax resembles a slender [[dragon]] with silver scales and opposable wings with a trident-like shape with jets on their tips. In battle it uses its wing's jets to shoot fireballs at its enemies, or to fly up at impossible speeds before falling down onto its target without giving them a chance to evade.

title: faye_(fire_emblem)
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia]], also appearing in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown_hair|brown]] [[twin braids]] with [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]s, two notable [[flipped hair|flipped]] portions of her hair, and has [[brown eyes]].  She wears a tattered brown [[corset]]ed [[dress]] with a white [[apron]].

She is a childhood friend of [[Alm (fire emblem)|]]'s, and follows him into battle. As her devotion to Alm (who is already clearly committed to [[Celica (fire emblem)|]]), she is frequently portrayed as [[yandere]] in her affection for Alm, and potentially violently jealous of Celica (although in-game, she gets a passive support with Celica and can be recruited by Celica's side).

Starting as a ("trainee"-type) villager unit, she could obtain many different possible final classes in Shadows of Valentia, from Paladin to Falcon Knight to Saint to Priestess. In spite of this, in Heroes, her only class is as an Archer, which is notably one of the few weapons she [i]couldn't[/i] learn to use.

title: twitch_plays_pokemon
body:
An event where tens of thousands of [[Twitch.tv|Twitch]] viewers played a single game of [[Pokemon]] through Twitch's chat system. [[Pokemon RGBY|Pokemon Red]] was conquered on March 1st, 2014 after ~390 hours. This was followed by Pokemon Crystal, Emerald, and (randomized) FireRed.

h4. [[Red (pokemon)|RED]]'s Pokémon

h6. Core Team

* [[Pidgeot]] (aaabaaajss, "Bird Jesus"/"ABBA Jesus")
* [[Omastar]] ("Lord Helix")
* [[Zapdos]] (AA–j, “Archangel of Justice”/"Anarchy Jesus")
* [[Nidoking]] (AAAAAAAAAA, "King Fonz")
* [[Lapras]] (AIIIIIIRRR, "Fresh Prince"/"Air Jordan")
* [[Venomoth]] (AATTVVV, "All Terrain Venomoth"/"Dragon Slayer")

h6. Other notable members

* [[Charmeleon]] (ABBBBBBK (, "Abby")
* [[Rattata]] (JLVWNNOOOO, "Jay Leno")
* [[Raticate]] (AAJST(????, "DigRat")
* [[Flareon]] ("The False Prophet"/"The Martyr")
* [[Drowzee]] ("The Keeper")
* [[Gloom (pokemon)|]] (x(araggbaj, "Cabbage")
* [[Farfetch'd]] (DUX, "Slayer of Trees")
* [[Gastly]] ("Rick Gastly")

h4. [[Ethan (pokemon)|AJDNNW]]'s Pokémon

h6. Core Team

* [[Feraligatr]] (AAAAtttta, “Lazorgator”)
* [[Pidgeot]] (BBBBBD, "Brian")
* [[Espeon]] (AAAS    RJ-I, “Burrito”/“Assassin”)
* [[Steelix]] (AAJRR RRR, "METAL GEAR")
* [[Dragonite]] (KT, "Katie")

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Twitch Plays Pokemon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitch_Plays_Pok%C3%A9mon

title: boomstick_(nikke)
body:

title: list_of_tianguan_cifu_characters
body:
Many characters in [[Tianguan Cifu]] use secondary identities, so some characters may appear twice. Names are taken from the Seven Seas translation, there may be differences with translations from other sources.

H4. Main Characters
* [[Xie Lian]]

title: weirdcore
body:
Aesthetic centered around combining nostalgic imagery with ominous, surreal or dreamlike elements.

This most often manifests as late 90s/early 2000s nostalgia, with images often looking like they were taken by early digital cameras. These are then edited with text or imagery (eyes, shadows) to unnerve the viewer or imply an unsafe, surreal, or all around "weird" enviorment.

Sometimes overlaps with [[liminal space]]s and the [[Backrooms (creepypasta)|]] in terms of subject matter, but may also overlap with [[Frutiger Aero]] or other web aesthetics when evoking nostalgia.

title: dark_meta_knight
body:
[[meta_knight|Meta Knight's]] dark counterpart, debuting in [i][[kirby_and_the_amazing_mirror|Kirby & The Amazing Mirror]][/i]. The game's story begins when he defeats his blue reflection and shatters the [[Dimension Mirror]], not before slashing at [[Kirby]] and creating three extra copies of him.

[spoiler]He makes a surprise return in [i][[kirby:_triple_deluxe|Kirby: Triple Deluxe]][/i], where he serves as the final boss of Dededetour, as well as the penultimate boss of the True Arena.[/spoiler]

He also appears in [i][[Kirby: Star Allies]][/i] as a Dream Friend. He is part of the second wave of post-launch Dream Friends alongside [[Daroach]], [[Adeleine]], and [[ribbon_(kirby)|Ribbon]].
H4. External links
* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Dark_Meta_Knight

title: warden_(minecraft)
body:
A [[monster|hostile]]/boss mob in [[Minecraft]], introduced since the 1.19 update. A horned, dark teal [[monster]] with wide open mouth, and visible soul particles on its chest that glows cyan. 

It can be summoned by an activated naturally-spawned [[sculk (minecraft)|]] shrieker located in the [[deep dark (minecraft)|]] biome. It is the only blind mob in the game, but still can detect players and other nearby entities through sound vibrations and scent. Wardens can walk as fast as player's sprinting speed. Its massive pool of hitpoints (500, equivalent to 250 hearts)— bolstered by its high-damage melee, ranged sonic attacks that can penetrate walls, immunity to fire and lava, and surprising intelligence —make it one of the most feared mobs in the game. Fighting one is guaranteed to result in the player's character dying.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Warden":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Warden

title: gurokawa
body:
Fashion style and visual aesthetic that is often conflated with [[yami kawaii]] due to both focusing on mixing cute elements with creepy ones. 

The key difference is that gurokawa evolved from [[decora]] and focuses on gory imagery, while yami kawaii evolved from [[yume kawaii]] and focuses on medical imagery. Gurokawa was popularized by [[Kyary Pamyu Pamyu]] in the 2010s.

Common visual motifs include dripping prints, eyeballs, bones and skeletons, and traditional halloween imagery like bats or ghosts.

h4. See also

* [[yami kawaii]]
* [[candy gore]]
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: yami_kawaii
body:

Sometimes called Menhera Kei.

h4. See also

title: bimbofication
body:
A fetish revolving around a character (particularly female) becoming a "bimbo", i.e. being an often airheaded, hypersexual version of themselves.

Typically, bimbofication involves drawing a character with exaggerated makeup and sexual characteristics, such as [[alternate_breast_size|giving them larger breasts]] or [[ass|hips]]. The character's personality is often changed to being fixated on sexual pleasure to various degrees (some retaining their original personality but with more libido, while some are depicted as a stereotypical carefree adulterer).

Bimbofication often stylized the character into a [[gyaru]] and/or [[ganguro]] state of dress in Japanese fetish art, though others simply gave them sexually provocative [[revealing clothes]] and often depicted them as [[prostitution|prostitutes]].

h4. See Also
* [[gyaru]]
* [[ganguro]]
* [[Feminization]]- a similar fetish that often results in a guy becoming hypersexually feminine
* [[Debimbofication (meme)|]]

title: aku_no_musume_(series)
body:
Major arc of [[Evillious Nendaiki]], named after the [[Aku no Musume (vocaloid)|eponymous song]] which spawned the series as a whole. Tells the story of [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]]'s disastrous reign as princess and the aftermath. Also known as "Aku no Monogatari".

The story was adapted into 4 novels, [i]Aku no Musume: Ki no Cloture[/i], [i]Aku no Musume: Midori no Wiegenlied[/i], [i]Aku no Musume: Aka no Praeludium[/i], and [i]Aku no Musume: Ao no Praefacio[/i].

title: shinora
body:
Early predecessor style to [[Decora]], derived from fans of the 1990s idol Shinohara Tomoe. Sometimes informally called "FRUiTS style" due to being commonly displayed in the magazine.

Still colorful, but often uses very clashing colors and patterns such as [[plaid clothes|plaid]], along with [[layered clothes|layering clothes]] and [[scarf|scarves]] instead of accessories like hair ornaments. [[Animal hat]]s, chunky [[buttons]], [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s and [[stuffed toy]]s were especially popular.

title: mahou_shoujo_ni_akogarete
body:
A softcore ecchi [[magical girl]] [[BDSM]] comedy manga by [[Ononaka Akihiro]] which started serialization in 2019 and received an anime adaptation on January 2024.

Hiiragi Utena is a plain girl who admires the magical girl team who defends her town, Tres Magia. One day she's approached by a mascot character to be granted power, not as a magical girl, but as a villain working for the evil organization Enormita.

h4. Characters

body:

With their forelimbs adapted as wings, they are the only mammals capable of true and sustained flight.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a white [[kepi]], [[double-breasted]] [[white dress]], [[black belt]], [[pantyhose]], [[high heels]], [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] [[black gloves]], and a [[white coat]]. title: dragon_ball:_the_breakers
body:
[B]Dragon Ball: The Breakers[/b] is an asymmetrical survival game in the style of [[Dead By Daylight]] that was released on October 14th, 2022. In the game, the player can either control an ordinary human in a team of 7 or one of the many [[Dragon Ball]] villains hunting down these humans. The [[survivor (dbtb)|ordinary humans]] are granted the ability to fight back against the villains using items called "transpheres" that allow them to take the power and form of countless characters in the series.

The game has been confirmed to take place in the same universe as [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]] and frequently has crossover promotions with the game.
other_names: ドラゴンボール_ザ_ブレイカーズ
ドラゴンボールザブレイカーズ

title: an_shan_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Gnevny-class/Anshan-class destroyer [i]An Shan[/i] (pennant number 101) in [[Azur Lane]].

Has dragon horns and green hair, a reference to her theme motif as the Azure Dragon/Seiryuu (a symbol of Imperial China, given that her class was the first destroyer class of China).

Her real-life destroyer counterpart was originally built for Soviet Pacific Fleet use before being transferred to China in 1953 and still exists as a museum ship in Qingdao since 1992.

Voiced by [[Asumi Kana]].

title: chang_chun_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Chinese (ex-Russian) destroyer [i]Changchun[/i] (pennant 103) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Alisa (kuro no sakura)|]], voiced by [[Mizuhashi Kaori]].

She has [[white hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[tiger print]] [[hood]] and [[armband]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[fake animal ears|false tiger ears on the hood]], reflective of her theme motif as the White Tiger/Byakko of the class. Her [[rigging]] consists of two 130 mm single gun mounts and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], one gun and torpedo mount on each side.

Her real-life destroyer counterpart was originally built for the Soviet Pacific Fleet before being sold to China in 1953, and still exists as a museum ship.

title: forbin_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the French destroyer [i]Forbin[/i], one of the 14 [i]L'Adroit[/i]-class destroyers. 
Character design by [[Yano Mitsuki (nanairo)|]], voiced by [[Hasegawa Akiko]].

In-game, she is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]], with a [[medium breasts|sizable chest size]].
Her outfit consists of a [[white dress]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], sleeveless [[blue jacket]] tied to the center, white [[thighhighs]], [[armored boots]] akin to a knight's, [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], and white [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single 130 mm gun mount to her right and 550 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]] to her left, held together by her bridge and funnel to her back with a range [[clock]] and [[mast]] that flies a variant of the [[French flag|French tricolor]].

h4. History
In real life, she was part of a squadron in Alexandria that was disarmed by the [[Royal Navy]] under Admiral [[Andrew Cunningham]] after he learned of the disastrous attempt to seize a larger French fleet at Mers-el-Kebir, Algeria.
She was handed over to the Free French in December 1943 with the rest of the Alexandria squadron and served until 1952.

title: fiji_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Fiji[/i] (pennant number 58).

Historically named after the Pacific country of the same name (under British rule as a colony), her class was essentially a scaled down version of the preceding Town-class light cruisers (specifically, the [[Edinburgh (Azur Lane)|]] design) to conform with the lower 8,000 ton displacement limit for cruisers under the Second London Treaty (as opposed to 10,000 tons in the previous Washington and First London Treaties).

She was lost to aerial attacks in May 1941 during operations off Crete to prevent the island from falling to German hands.

title: survivor_(dbtb)
body:
The [b]Survivor[/b] is the player character featured in the game [[Dragon Ball: The Breakers]]. Like the [[mirai senshi]] of [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]], the Survivor is customizable in physical appearance, clothing, and skills.

The game describes the Survivor as being a very unlucky person that constantly falls victim to attacks from the game's villains and is from the real world.

title: tiara
body:
A [[hairband]] made of metal, with a simple design and which may be embellished with gems or other ornaments. Often worn by fantasy heroines, princesses or pop idols.

Compared to a [[crown]], the band of a tiara is usually narrow and shaped like a semi-circle. A tiara is normally worn on the top of the head, not over the forehead like a [[circlet]].

title: emden_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification(s) of the Imperial German Navy light cruiser SMS [i]Emden[/i]. Or more specifically the 1908 [i]Dresden[/i]-class light cruiser and the 1916 [i]Koenigsburg[/i]-class light cruiser.

h4. Appearance
Emden appears as [[2girls|two girls]] with one having a light-color scheme and the other with dark colors, each with a [[flower over eye|flower]] over one eye. This is a reference to the two ships named [i]Emden[/i] built by the German Empire, with the latter being a [i]Koenigsburg[/i]-class cruiser, being first laid down in 1916 and inherited the name of the more famous predecessor which were scuttled in 1914.

h4. History
In real life, the first SMS [i]Emden[/i] was the second member of the [i]Dresden[/i]-class light cruisers, powered by older triple expansion engines (think of the engines on the [i]Titanic[/i]) instead of newer steam turbines, the last German warship to be so equipped.

She saw action with the East Asia squadron based in Qingdao and engaged in commerce raiding and an engagement against an Allied fleet in Penang, Malaysia in October 1914. Two months later, she was run aground after sustaining severe damage in an engagement with an Australian cruiser, and her crew were forced to scuttle the ship.

The second SMS [i]Emden[/i] was a [i]Koenigsburg[/i]-class cruiser laid down in 1916. She saw little action for the rest of the war. She is one of the several ships that were scuttled during the internment at Scapa Flow in 1919, though she was beached to save her from sinking by the British. [i]Emden[/i]'s hulk was later transferred to France as reparations before being scrapped in 1926.

title: gwen_tennyson
body:
Cousin of the [[ben tennyson|titular hero]] in [i][[Ben 10]][/i] and its sequels. Casually known as [b]Gwen[/b]. 

In the original series, she has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] and [[green eyes]], and wears a [[hairclip]] and a shirt with [[raglan sleeves]]. In [i][[Ben 10: Alien Force]][/i], she has [[long hair]] instead and wears a [[sweater]] with a [[skirt]]. In the post-timeskip sequels, she becomes [[kevin levin|Kevin]]'s girlfriend.

Due to the broader cultural impact of the original series over its sequels, depictions of Gwen generally skew towards her 10 year old self or make reference to it, over her 15+ year old self (or even 30+ year old self from the original's future episodes).

title: tiger_lily
body:
[b][i]Lilium lancifolium[/i][/b], commonly called tiger lily, is a species of [[lily (flower)|]], family [i]Liliaceae[/i].

Like other lilies, tiger lily flowers are six-petaled and borne on an upright stem. The flowers tend to nod, with six petals bent backwards and six long stamens spread out. The showy flowers are bright [[orange flower|orange]] with black or brown-red spots. There are also yellow and spotless varieties. The leaves are lanceolate (lance-shaped).

Its Japanese name is オニユリ ([b]鬼百合[/b] [i]oni-yuri[/i], lit. [[Oni]] lily). The curved back petals are associated with oni horns, and the bright orange color is associated with red oni.

Not to be confused with [[gloriosa (flower)|]], which has similar features, but unlike tiger lily, gloriosa petals are wavy and spotless.

h4. Examples
* !asset #23693432: Plant
* !post #8138861: Flower
* !post #1464255

h4. Non-examples

* !asset #21007005: [[Gloriosa (flower)|]]

title: blind_al
body:
Althea Winifred Sanderson, better known as Blind Al, is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. She is commonly depicted as a supporting character of the antihero [[Deadpool]].

Al first appeared in Deadpool #1, living with him in "The Deadhut", his house in San Francisco. At first her relationship with him was unclear, but over time it would reveal itself as highly complex and bizarre.

Actress Leslie Uggams portrayed Blind Al in the 2016 feature film Deadpool and its 2018 sequel set in the [[X-Men film series]]. She also reprised the role in [[Deadpool & Wolverine]] (2024), set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU).

title: dewey_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Farragut[/i]-class destroyer USS [i]Dewey[/i] (DD-349) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Huoyi (zzh100200)|]], voiced by Shimabukuro Miyuri.

In-game, she is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and yellowish-[[brown eyes]] with [[small breasts]].
Her outfit consists of a white [[garrison cap]], a black [[collar]] with an [[anchor]], a [[sleeveless]] [[double-breasted]] white top and grey chest dress, [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], white [[thighhighs]], [[rudder footwear]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of a 12.7 cm single gun mount Mk21 on her left, 53.3 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her right, and a funnel to her back.

title: martin_luther
body:
Martin Luther (1483-1546) was a [[real life]] German [[priest]], theologian, author, hymn-writer, professor, and Augustinian friar who formed the basis for Protestant Christianity and the Lutheran sect.

Not to be confused with American Civil rights activist, [b]Martin Luther King Jr[/b].

title: shaak_ti
body: Character from [[Star Wars]], Shaak Ti is a female [[Togruta]], a colorful and exotic alien species, from the planet Shili. Shaak Ti is a member of the [[Jedi]] High Council and a Jedi General during the Clone Wars. She is a very well respected warrior, known for slaying Artel Darc and surviving an encounter with [[General Grievous]]. Shaak Ti is portrayed in the Star Wars films by Orli Shoshan in Episodes II & III.

title: emo_fashion
body:
A fashion style that were popular amongst teenagers during [[2000]]s.

In some sense, it is a mix of [[punk]] and [[goth fashion|goth]] fashion, with an emphasis on black or darker-toned clothing, uses of [[piercing]]s, heavy makeups (especially eyeliners), among other things. 

[[Scene fashion]] is a more colorful derivative style. The two styles are sometimes blurred, with this blur being referred to as "Scemo".

h4. Examples

* !post #7530803
* !post #7554863
* !post #5078752

h4. See also

title: cleveland_brown
body: Cleveland Orenthal Brown Sr. is a fictional character from the animated television series [[Family Guy]], and its spin-off series The Cleveland Show. He is a neighbor and friend of the Griffin family and is best known for his mild-mannered deadpan delivery. His established profession was that of a deli owner, before he switched over to being a postal worker after his return to Family Guy.

title: pl-10
body:
The PL-10 (霹雳-10; lit. [i]Thunderbolt[/i]) is a short-range air-to-air [[missile]] developed by the [[China|People's Republic of China]]. Development of the missile commenced in 2004 for use on stealth fighters such as the [[Chengdu j-20]] and it entered production in 2013. According to the assessment by Royal United Services Institute, the PL-10 provides comparable performance to European [[ASRAAM]] and [[IRIS-T]] missiles, while offering superior kinematic performances against [[AIM-9 Sidewinder|AIM-9X]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: PL-10":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PL-10]

title: castlevania_(series)
body:
A side-scrolling platformer video game series by [[Konami]], known in Japan as 悪魔城ドラキュラ ([i]Akumajou Dracula[/i], lit. [i]Devil's Castle Dracula[/i]).

The player typically controls one character at a time, often of the Belmont clan, in a journey through [[Dracula (castlevania)|]]'s demon castle, Castlevania, to defeat him and his hordes.

The series was originally a straightforward, level-based 2D platformer, but with the release of the PlayStation entry [[Castlevania: Symphony of the Night]], the formula became more adventure-based and exploration-focused (to the point of being [[Metroid]]-like, coining the term "Metroidvania") and subsequently a hit, with most subsequent entries following its build.

title: kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_bakuen_wo!
body:
[b]Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo![/b] (English: [i]KonoSuba: An Explosion on This Wonderful World![/i]) is a light novel series, a prequel spin-off of the [[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!|KonoSuba]] series, written by Akatsuki Natsume and illustrated by [[Mishima Kurone]]. It received a light novel sequel and a manga adaptation, as well as a television anime adaptation produced by Drive (studio) that aired between April and June 2023.

The story takes place one year before the main series and focuses on [[Megumin]] when she was a student at the Red Prison Magic School in the Crimson Demon Village, her home.
other_names: この素晴らしい世界に爆焔を!

title: himekaji
body:
Style of popular Japanese [[fashion]] that evolved from [[Hime Gyaru]] - originally being a gyaru substyle, though nowadays it has become detached from gyaru. The name means "princess casual", and it is considered to be a part of the wider umbrella of "girly kei". In Japan, it is also called Kanayan style, after the model who popularized it.

Himekaji uses a color palette primarily consisting of pinks, whites, and tans. [[Pom pom (clothes)|]] decorations and [[fur trim]]s are common, as are [[rhinestone]]s and [[floral print]]. Popular brands in the style include [[Liz Lisa]], DearMyLove, and Ank Rouge.

It is sometimes confused for the ryousangata side of [[jirai kei]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7193800
* !post #6860511

h4. See also

* [[tag group:fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Aesthetic Wiki: Himekaji":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Himekaji
* "Gyaru Wiki: Himekaji":https://gyaru-109.fandom.com/wiki/Himekaji

title: hime_gyaru
body:
A substyle of [[Gyaru]] fashion with a princessy aesthetic, primarily using a soft color palette with lots of pinks and whites.

Hairstyles are usually voluminous and feature [[ringlets]], in colors such as blonde, brown, and ginger. [[Decoden]] is often used on cellphones, fingernails, and accessories. Clothing tends to have lots of [[frills]] and [[bow]]s, often with [[lace trim]] or [[fur trim]], and [[floral print]]s.

[[Himekaji]] is a casual girly style that evolved from Hime Gyaru.

h4. See also

* [[tag group:fashion style]]

body:

Off-shoulder shirts are meant to emphasize and accentuate the wearer's shoulders, [[collarbone]], and neck (or [[nape]]), with the sleeves of an off-shoulder shirt sitting on the upper arms instead of on top of the shoulders.

title: dislyte
body: A gacha RPG developed by Lilith Games and FARLIGHT, released in May 2022. It is unique for its modern, urban fantasy setting and focus on music and real-world mythology as core motifs. Players take control of Espers - individuals imbued with divine power by otherworldly disasters called Miracles, with their powers based on real-world mythological figures. For example, [[Drew (Anubis) (Dislyte)|Drew]] is the Esper of Anubis, and [[Tang Xuan (sun wukong) (dislyte)|Tang Xuan]] is the Esper of [[Sun Wukong]].
