title: reiuji_utsuho
body:
The "Scorching, Troublesome Divine Flame". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Subterranean Animism]][/i] and later a playable character in [i][[touhou_hisoutensoku|Hisoutensoku]][/i]. A hell raven who absorbed the powers of a [[yatagarasu]], giving her the power to manipulate nuclear fusion which she then used to try to conquer the surface. Her nickname is "Okuu" (おくう), which is based on an alternate reading of the kanji in her name. Both Reiuji and [[Kaenbyou Rin]] are pets of [[Komeiji Satori]] and live in [[Chireiden]]. 

Her (fan-given) catchprase is '[[Unyu]]'; she is also known as [[circled 6|⑥]] because, like [[Cirno]] (whose nickname is [[circled 9|⑨]]), she is rather dumb and the strongest of the Former Hell, only difference is, she actually [i]is[/i] strong.  "⑥" also reflects her status as a Stage 6 boss, and the notion of her heat-based powers being the inverse of Cirno and her ice abilities.

Her spellcards are announced with a highly visible [[radiation symbol]] and while [[pointing up]] towards the [[black sun]], often while holding her [[arm cannon]] based on a [[control rod (touhou)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #636064: [[Subterranean Animism]]
* !asset #23743151: [[Sunken Fossil World]]

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] or [[brown hair]] tied with a [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow]] and [[red eyes]], including her [[third eye]] on her chest. Her outfit is a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and sometimes [[frilled shirt|frills on the bottom]] and the [[frilled shirt collar|collar]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[green skirt]], a [[white cape]] with a [[starry sky print|starry]] [[print cape|print]] on the [[two-sided cape|reverse side]] over her [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings|wings]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].


h4. See also

* [[Kokuu Haruto]]

title: marblehead_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the light cruiser USS [i]Marblehead[/i] (CL-12). Character designed by [[Silveroid]]. 

She is a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] [[gyaru]] with [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[short hair with long locks]] [[pink hair|with a pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit comprises a [[white jacket]] with [[sleeves past fingers]], [[wrist scrunchie]], white dress top, [[leotard]], [[black shorts]], [[black thighhighs]], and an [[ID card]] showing her pre-gyaru original form. Her [[rigging]] consists of two twin and four single 152 mm gun mounts.

Her design instantly sparked conversation among players and non-players because her ID card appears to contain a reference to the (in)famous hentai manga [[Emergence (shindol)|]].

title: amagi_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the battlecruiser [i][[amagi_(battlecruiser)|Amagi]][/i] in [[Azur Lane]], introduced as part of the [i]Crimson Echoes[/i] event. Character design by [[Liduke]], voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

She is a [[kyuubi]] [[fox girl]] like her younger sister [[Akagi_(azur_lane)|]], with [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[purple eyes]] with red pupils. Her outfit consists of a [[red haori]] over a [[crane print]] dark [[purple kimono]] with [[bodystocking]] underneath, and an [[oil-paper umbrella]] in her hand in addition to her [[rigging]].

A natural strategist, Amagi is much more level-headed than Akagi, always behaving in a professional manner and being respectful towards the [[Commander (azur lane)|]]. However, she suffers from coughing fits, a reference to how her keel snapped during her conversion to a carrier in an earthquake, and is highly conscious of her own frail health, which is manifested in the story as a [[Wisdom Cube (azur lane)|]] with a crack on it.

The historical [i]Amagi[/i] was supposed to be the first in a four-ship class of battlecruisers, developed as part of the Imperial Japanese Navy's Eight-Eight Fleet Program. However, construction was halted as a result of the Washington Naval Treaty, before she and [i]Akagi[/i] underwent conversion into aircraft carriers. [i]Amagi[/i]'s conversion, however, was cut short when her keel snapped during the Great Kanto Earthquake, forcing her to be scrapped like her other two sister ships two years later. 

[[Amagi (cv) (azur lane)|A UR reimagination of her]] is introduced in the 7th anniversary [i]Ode of Everblooming Crimson[/i] event in September 2024. In the event story, Amagi completed her fateful conversion to an [i]Amagi[/i]-class aircraft carrier, restoring her to full health in the process.

h4. Skins
h6. The [[Amagi (CV) (Throne of Fallen Petals) (Azur Lane)|dress skin]] of Amagi-CV cannot be used on Amagi-BC.

* !post #3364974: Default
* !post #4048696: [[Amagi (wending waters serene lotus) (azur lane)|Wending Waters Serene Lotus]]

title: completely_nude
body:
Wearing no clothing from the neck down. This means that [[glasses]], [[hat]]s, and other such clothing items do not count against the tag.

[[Jewelry]] and small accessories such as [[wristband]]s, [[anklet]]s, [[tail ribbon]]s, etc, don't count against the tag.

Towels are fine as long as they are held, and aren't tied to the body or adherent to the body (eg. post #4065442). If the second case applies, please tag as [[naked towel]] or [[nude cover]].

[[Naked chocolate]] or other such fluids poured on a body do not count against the tag.

[[Rope]]s and [[belt]]s do count against the tag. Even if used in [[BDSM]].

Make sure you can see their crotch or lower, otherwise see [[nude]].

h4. See also

* [[nude]]
* [[Tag Group:Nudity]]

title: san_diego_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]] character based on the [i]Atlanta[/i]-class light cruiser [[USS San Diego (CL-53)]], the second ship to carry the name.

She has [[red_hair|red]] [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. One of her quotes is related to American Shengdiyage's Chinese fertiliser [[Jinkela]]. Her personality is exceedingly air-headed and ditzy, often forgetting information that was recently given to her and being more concerned with having fun.

San Diego is notorious among the fanbase for being the most common Super-Rare drop, a reputation similar to Kantai Collection's [[Naka (kancolle)|]]. She has developed a so-called "cult", dedicated to spreading her message of how she is Number One.

However her [[retrofit (azur lane)|]] (the first one given to an SSR/Super Rare ship) has improved her to the point where "Number One" is unironic even outside of Anti-Air (which she always excelled at).

title: scarecrow_(batman)
body: The Scarecrow is a supervillain appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. Created by writer Bill Finger and artist Bob Kane, the character first appeared in World's Finest Comics #3 (September 1941). The Scarecrow has become one of the superhero [[batman|Batman's]] most enduring enemies belonging to the collective of adversaries that make up his rogues gallery.
other_names: スケアクロウ(バットマン)

title: cyborg_(dc)
body: Cyborg (Victor "Vic" Stone) is a superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. The character was created by writer Marv Wolfman and artist George Pérez, and first appeared in an insert preview in DC Comics Presents #26 (October 1980).Originally known as a member of the [[Teen Titans]], Cyborg was established as a founding member of the [[Justice League]] in DC's 2011 reboot of its comic book titles, replacing [[Martian Manhunter]].

title: blue_beetle
body: Blue Beetle is the name of three superheroes appearing in a number of American comic books published by a variety of companies since 1939. The most recent of the companies to own rights to Blue Beetle is [[DC Comics]], which bought the rights to the character in 1983, using the name for three distinct characters over the years.

title: seele_vollerei_(herrscher_of_rebirth)
body:
A playable [[official alternate costume|battlesuit]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Seele Vollerei]]. 

Her base Herrscher of Rebirth outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress]] with asymmetrical straps linking it to her [[white choker]], a white [[thigh strap]] on her left, and [[blue flower]]s. 

Unlike other Herrschers who originate from the [[Cocoon of Finality (honkai impact)|]], hers comes from [[Sa (honkai impact)|]] instead. Having gained a new body, her former body has become that of [[seele_(alter_ego)|her Alter Ego]]. She has two familiars/summons: [[Diana_(honkai_impact)|]] and [[Flora_(honkai_impact)|]]. 

She has two other alternate costumes with this outfit: her [[Seele Vollerei (Eternal Night's Embrace)|Eternal Night's Embrace]] party dress and her [[seele_vollerei_(summer_2023)|Summer bikini]]. 

h4. Appearance

title: spider-gwen
body:
A [[Marvel]] comics character, first debuted in the Spider-Verse comic book storyline in 2014. Her real name is [b]Gwendolyne Maxine "Gwen" Stacy[/b], a variant of [[Gwen Stacy]] from Earth-65 continuity in which Gwen was bitten by a radioactive spider instead of [[Peter Parker]]. Her codename was [b]Spider-Woman[/b], later changed to [b]Ghost-Spider[/b].

Spider-Gwen has appeared in media other than comic books since her debut, including animated shows, animated films and video games. Her popularity led to the creation of another character based on Gwen Stacy, [[Gwenpool]].
other_names: スパイダー・グウェン

title: biwa_lute
body:
The [b]biwa[/b] (琵琶) is a Japanese short-necked fretted [[lute (instrument)|]], often used in narrative storytelling. The biwa is the chosen instrument of Benten, goddess of music, eloquence, poetry, and education in Japanese Shinto.

The main point of differentiation between the biwa and the [[pipa (instrument)|]] (visually) is that the biwa has a bent neck, while the pipa has a straight neck, like an [[acoustic guitar]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Audio tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Biwa":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biwa

title: fangs
body:
For images of characters featuring multiple prominent canine teeth, such as with [[vampire|vampires]] or various animals.

Distinct from [[fang]], which refers to a single visible prominent canine tooth. This is a visual trait often meant to emphasize a specific aspect of a character's personality.

Distinct from [[sharp teeth]], where [b]all[/b] of a character's teeth are sharp--although it is possible for a character to have both, if the canines are noticeably larger than the rest.

Opposite of [[tusks]] which are typically larger lower teeth, usually on [[orc]]s or [[mammoth]]s.

h4. See also

* [[fangs out]]
* [[skin fangs]]

title: hickey
body:
A hickey, love bite, or slag tag is a bruise or mark caused by the [[kiss]]ing or sucking of the skin, usually on the neck or arm. The mark is created by the bursting of superficial small blood vessels under the skin.

It's sometimes called a "kiss mark", but this should not be confused with the [[lipstick mark]] tag. Also, apparently both lipstick marks and hickeys are tagged as キスマーク on Pixiv.

title: titania_(sao)
body:
[[Asuna (SAO)|]]'s original Alfheim Online avatar as the Fairy Queen, Titania. She was forced to use this avatar when she was captured by Fairy King [[Oberon (SAO)|]], during the Fairy Dance Arc of [[Sword Art Online]]. In this avatar, she had [[elf]] [[pointy ears]] and [[fairy]] [[wings]]. She wore a white outfit with a [[long skirt|long]] [[white skirt]], a [[crop top]] showing her [[midriff]], and a red ribbon that went around the topmost part of her top that came together to make a bow. She went barefoot, and wore a white strip around her ankles.

Do not be confused with [[Asuna (SAO-ALO)]], her main Alfheim Online avatar used in subsequent arcs.

title: peanut_the_squirrel
body:
Peanut the Squirrel, a social media star with over 500,000 followers on Instagram and TikTok, was a beloved pet rescued by Mark Longo after his mother was hit by a car.

On October 30, 2024, the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) seized Peanut and a raccoon named Fred from Longo's home following anonymous complaints about potential rabies risk and illegal wildlife ownership.
During the raid, Peanut allegedly bit an officer, leading to the euthanization of both animals to test for rabies.

h4. External Links
* "Instagram: Peanut the Squirrel":[https://www.instagram.com/peanut_the_squirrel12]
* "P'nuts Freedom Farm Animal Sanctuary":[https://www.pnutsfreedomfarm.com/]
* "Wikipedia: Peanut (squirrel)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peanut_(squirrel)]

title: diary_30:_superman_is_coming_to_school_(meme)
body:
Posts referencing a set of videos from March 2007 by Youtuber Daxflame called:

[b]Diary 30: Superman Is Coming to School[/b]
[b]Diary 31: Humiliation[/b]

In the first video he explains how he plans to show off his muscles in a Superman costume to a girl and then ask her out.
In the second video he shares his regrets about wearing the costume and called it the most embarrassing day of his life.
The stark difference in both the tone and the thumbnails of the videos caused these to go viral.

h4. External Links
* "KnowYourMeme: Diary 30: Superman Is Coming to School / Diary 31: Humiliation":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/diary-30-superman-is-coming-to-school-diary-31-humiliation]
* "YouTube: Diary 30: Superman is coming to school":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ki32wfWqMXc]
* "YouTube: Diary 31: Humiliation":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h0-sl315b5Y]

title: krusty_the_clown
body:
[b]Krusty the Clown[/b] is one of the many characters of the American animated comedy sitcom [[The Simpsons]].
He is the long-time clown host of [[bart simpson|Bart]] and [[lisa simpson|Lisa Simpson's]] favorite TV show, a variety show consisting of various kid-friendly sketches and often highly violent cartoons, most notably The [[Itchy & Scratchy]] Show. Despite his cheery onscreen persona, Krusty is actually a cynical, burnt-out, addiction-riddled smoker who is made miserable by show business but continues on anyway. He has become one of the most frequently occurring characters outside the main Simpson family and has been the focus of many episodes, some of which also feature [[Sideshow Bob]].

title: santa's_little_helper
body: Santa's Little Helper is a fictional dog in the American animated television series [[The Simpsons]]. He is the pet greyhound of the Simpson family. He was previously voiced by Frank Welker, and is currently voiced by Dan Castellaneta. The dog was introduced in the first episode of the show, the 1989 [[Christmas]] special "Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire", in which his owner abandons him for finishing last in a greyhound race. [[Homer Simpson]] and his son [[bart simpson|Bart]], who are at the race track in hope of winning some money for Christmas presents, see this and decide to adopt the dog.
other_names: サンタズリトルヘルパー

title: prinz_eugen_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the German heavy cruiser [i]Prinz Eugen[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Designed by [[Realmbw]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]], [[grey hair|grey]], or [[aqua hair]] tied up in a [[two side up]] and with a small red highlight. Her eyes are [[orange eyes|orange]]. Her outfit is a grey and red [[double-breasted]] dress with [[long sleeves]] and a notable [[side cutout]] showing her [[armpits]] and [[sideboob]], and also that she has a [[mole_on_breast|mole on her right breast]]. There are several [[iron cross|iron crosses]] adorning her outfit near the collar and on her sleeves. She wears [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]]. Prinz Eugen also lacks a skirt of any sort, with her [[panties]] readily exposed.

h4. Costumes
* !post #2893365: Default
* !post #3632597: [[Prinz Eugen (Cordial Cornflower) (Azur Lane)|Cordial Cornflower]]
* !post #2967758: [[Prinz Eugen (Profusion of Flowers) (Azur Lane)|Profusion of Flowers]]
* !post #3173409: [[Prinz Eugen (Symphonic Fate) (Azur Lane)|Symphonic Fate]]
* !post #2895390: [[Prinz Eugen (Unfading Smile) (Azur Lane)|Unfading Smile]]
* !post #4910720: [[Prinz Eugen (Final Lap) (Azur Lane)|Final Lap]]
* !post #5383143: [[Prinz Eugen (Kindred Evening Spirits) (Azur Lane)|Kindred Evening Spirits]]
* !post #7773120: [[Prinz Eugen (Brilliant Touchdown) (Azur Lane)|Brilliant Touchdown]]

h4. Alternative versions

* !post #7478549: [[Prinz Eugen (muse) (Azur Lane)|Muse]]
* !post #5317900: [[Little Prinz Eugen (azur lane)|]]

h4. Personality
She is confident, teasing and sensual on the outside. This, combined with her figure and her status as a login reward for new players, made her one of the most popular characters in the game. However, this is largely an act, as internally she is generally apathetic as a result of being traumatized by her history of surviving some of the most brutal naval battles of the war and two subsequent nuclear detonations in [[Operation Crossroads]]. She often laments how ironically lucky she was, and if deployed together, [[z1 leberecht maass (azur lane)|Z1]] will comment on how fake her smile is; [[Prince of Wales (Azur Lane)|]], her enemy-turned-friend, also mentions this. When her affection is maxed out (and when married), she thanks the [[Commander (azur lane)|]] for making her happy and fulfilled, stating that she is finally smiling for real.

title: bowing_and_scraping
body:
A form of [[bowing]] in which the bower waves one hand in front of themselves, extending the other arm off to the side.

The term "to bow and scrape" comes from the gesture often being a deep bow, resulting in one of the bower's feet scraping backwards on the ground behind them for balance. For Danbooru's purposes, the bower's feet do not need to be scraping (or even visible) for this tag to apply.

title: chiyoda_(azur_lane)
body:
Chiyoda is the second ship of the [i]Chitose[/i]-class light aircraft carriers in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 
Character jointly designed by [[Suisai (suisao)|]] and [[Yuui Hutabakirage]]. 


h4. Appearance 

Chiyoda has [[medium_hair|medium length]] [[red_hair|red hair]] with a single [[hair_ribbon|hair ribbon]] on the left side, [[red_eyes|red eyes]] and [[fox_ears|fox ears]] on her head. 

She wears a black and gold [[fox_mask|fox mask]] on her head. She loosely wears a [[White_kimono|white kimono]] with a dark red and gold [[floral_pattern|floral pattern]] on the sleeves, a black [[halterneck]], [[red_skirt|red]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated skirt]], white [[tabi|tabi socks]] and [[geta|geta sandals]]. She has [[claw_rings|brass claw rings]] on her fingers that serve as a means of controlling her [[shikigami|shikigami]].

She along with her sister got a [[chiyoda_(shimmering_surf)_(azur_lane)|summer CG]] upon being introduced into the game. She wears a [[red_bikini|red bikini]] with golden [[high_heels|high heals]], a [[choker|black choker]] and a [[flower|flower]] in her [[hair_flower|hair]]. She also has a [[beachball]] with her.

h4. Personality

Chiyoda has a playful and mischievous personality. She often slips protective charms in the the commanders clothes.

Both she and Chiyoda are good Kagura dancers, they often rehearse with Fuso and Yamashiro.

h4. History

Chiyoda originally built as the second vessel of the Chitose Class seaplane tenders launched on the 19th November 1937. She along with her sister were both converted and reclassified as Light Aircraft Carriers. As a carrier she participated in the Battle of the Philippine Sea and the Battle of Leyte Gulf.

She would finally meet her end during the battle of Cape Engano on the 25th October 1944 where she along with Zuikaku, Zuihou and Chiyoda were used as a sacrificial decoy force to lure the American fleet away from the landing beaches in the Philippines. She was crippled the 4 bombs dropped by US carrier aircraft and was ultimately finished off by surface gunfire from a surface task force consisting of 4 cruisers and 9 destroyers. Chiyoda sank with her entire crew of 1,470 officers and men, there were no survivors.

h4. Trivia
* Both [i]Chitose[/i] and herself (plus [i][[Ryuuhou (Azur Lane)|]][/i]) are classified as [i]Zuihou[/i]-class CVLs in-game (technically [i][[Shouhou (Azur Lane)|]][/i]-class) despite [i]Zuihou[/i] and the [i]Chitose[/i]-class CVLs not having anything in common apart from being conversions of seaplane tenders.
* She is voiced by Hitomi Sekine who also provided the voice for Chitose.

title: watermark
body:
An image containing text or a [[logo]] superimposed on top of the image. Typically to identify the owner/creator of the work and/or prevent the image from being counterfeited. Some watermarks are also deliberately placed as a "paywall" on "samples" of "[[paid reward]]" images.

Posts with watermarks added by [[third-party watermark|third-parties]] (anyone other than the artist) should not be uploaded.

Add [[watermark grid]] if it spans over a majority/the whole image. Add [[too many watermarks]] if it's in excess as to be noticeable from the thumbnail.

title: chapayev_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Soviet light cruiser [i]Chapayev[/i], the name ship/lead ship of her class. 
Character designed by [[Gujianshaonu]]. 

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[white jacket|white military jacket]] exposing her [[cleavage]], white [[peaked cap]], [[pantyhose]], [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]], and [[black gloves]]. Her rigging consists of two of her real-life 152 mm triple mounts on her left side, with a blank hull piece to her right and connected by a [[chain]].

h4. History
In real life, her design was meant to correct the stability and gunnery issues that plagued [i][[Kirov (Azur Lane)|]][/i] and her sisters, and was laid down in 1939. Launched just before the German invasion, she was left uncompleted until the war ended and she was only completed in 1950.

Her skills (cavalier-themed) reference her namesake, the Russian Revolutionary folk hero Vasily Chapayev.

title: dogeza
body:
An element of traditional Japanese etiquette: kneeling directly on the ground and bowing to prostrate oneself until one's head touches the floor in order to show deference to a greatly revered high-class person, as a deep apology, or to express the desire for a favor from said person.

For the pose itself (without the intent of deference or apology), see [[prostration]].

title: ojigi_(bowing)
body:
The classic Japanese [[bowing|bow]]. The bower bends at the waist while keeping their back straight and their head perpendicular to their torso, either placing their hands together in front of them or leaving their arms at their sides. The deeper the bow, the more respect is being shown to the recipient.

title: centaur_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the aircraft carrier HMS [i]Centaur[/i] (R06). Character design by [[Tony Taka]], voiced by [[Uchida Aya]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] done [[two side up]] and with an [[ahoge]], [[aqua eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and [[medium breasts]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[white dress]] top with [[breast curtains]] and [[no bra]], [[detached sleeves]], blue [[hair flower]]s, [[white skirt]],  [[white panties]], [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[single thighhigh]] on her right, [[kneehighs|kneehigh]] on her left), a frilled blue [[thigh strap]] on her left leg, and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. She uses a [[bow (weapon)|]] much like the US carrier girls, patterned off her real-life hull and masts.

She refers to all the other carrier girls as her [i]senpai[/i] (officially translated as "Elders") on account of the fact that she and her sister were, in real life, laid down in 1944 and commissioned in 1953/1954, well after [[World War II]] had ended.

title: saint-louis_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]] character.

Added as part of a collaboration between [[Azur Lane]] and [[World of Warships]], Saint-Louis is based off of a [i]Marine Nationale[/i] heavy cruiser proposal designated "C5". The project was intended to bolster France's cruiser forces after the restrictions of the Washington Naval Treaty had been lifted, succeeding [i][[Algerie (azur lane)|Algeriè]][/i] and similar ships. However, design work was suspended after the Fall of France, and no ships of the class were ever laid down.

She is named after King Louis IX of France, the only French monarch canonized as a saint.

Saint-Louis is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[red eyes]] and [[large breasts]], dressed in crusader-inspired attire. She holds strong religious ideals, believing herself to be subject to God's will. 

As a reference to the game from which she was taken, Saint-Louis has skills that improve her high-explosive damage and increase her speed for short periods of time.

Not to be confused with [[St. Louis (azur lane)|]].
Voiced by [[Seto Asami]].

h4. Skins

* [[saint-louis (holy knight's resplendence) (azur lane)|Holy Knight's Resplendence]]

title: carabiniere_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian Navy Soldati-class destroyer, [i]Carabiniere[/i]. Character design by [[Kaede (Yumesaki Kaede)|]], voiced by [[Tachibana Rika]].

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit is the historic [i]Arma dei Carabinieri[/i]'s black-colored [[military uniform]] with its distinctive feathered [[bicorne]], [[black cape]], silver [[epaulettes]], and [[white gloves]]. She also wears black [[knee boots]] with [[paravane|paravanes]] attached to them, a [[single thighhigh]] with a [[garter straps|garter strap]], as well as a [[white belt]] with a [[saber (weapon)|]] attached to it. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a 533 mm triple torpedo mount on her left and a 120 mm twin gun mount on her right, with the monogram "IR" (meaning "Italian Republic") etched on one of the joints below the gun mount. She is also shown wielding a [[musket]] as a sidearm.

h4. Skins

* !post #3655012: Default
* !post #3655020: [[carabiniere (refreshing sundress) (azur lane)|Refreshing Sundress]]

h4. History
In real life, [i]Carabiniere[/i] was the seventh member of the Soldati-class, launched and completed in 1938. She saw service in the battles of Calabria and Cape Matapan, ultimately surviving the armistice and the war. She was among the destroyers retained by the post-war Italian Navy, who refitted her as an anti-submarine destroyer (pennant D551) before being decommissioned in 1965.

h4. [i]Soldati[/i]-class destroyer
* [b]Carabiniere[/b]

h4. External link
* "Wikipedia: Italian destroyer [i]Carabiniere[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_destroyer_Carabiniere_(1938)]

title: black_prince_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Black Prince[/i] (81).
Character design by [[Suisai (suisao)|]], voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

In-game, she has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]] with a black [[hair bow]]. Her default uniform comprises a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]], black [[corset]], [[black skirt]] with [[gold trim]], [[pantyhose]], single [[thigh strap]] to her right, [[rudder footwear]], and differently-colored [[elbow gloves]]: [[black gloves|black]] on her left and [[white gloves|white]] on her right.

Her [[rigging]] consists of two main parts, each with two 13.3 cm twin DP mounts and 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] colored red, held together by a funnel attachment to her back.

h4. Skins

title: chris_rock
body:
Christopher Julius Rock (born February 7, 1965) is an American stand-up comedian, actor, writer, producer, and film director.
He developed, wrote, produced and narrated the sitcom [[Everybody Hates Chris]] (2005–2009), which was based on his early life. From 1997 to 2000 HBO aired his talk show The Chris Rock Show.
Rock was cast in starring film roles in Lethal Weapon 4 (1998), Dogma (1999), The Longest Yard (2005), the [[madagascar (series)|Madagascar series]] (2005–2012), I Think I Love My Wife (2007), Grown Ups (2010), Death at a Funeral (2010), Top Five (2014), The Week Of (2018), Spiral (2021), Amsterdam (2022), and Rustin (2023).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chris Rock":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Rock]

h4.See also

* [[Will Smith slapping Chris Rock (meme)]]

title: everybody_hates_chris
body: Everybody Hates Chris is an American semi-autobiographical sitcom created by [[Chris Rock]] and Ali LeRoi that originally aired on UPN from 2005 to 2006, and then on The CW until 2009. The series is based loosely on Rock's personal experiences as a teenager living in Bedford–Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, New York City from 1982 to 1987. However, Rock's real-life adolescence took place from 1978 to 1984, having been born in 1965.

title: jason_momoa
body:
Joseph Jason Namakaeha Momoa (/məˈmoʊə/; born August 1, 1979) is an American actor. He made his acting debut as Jason Ioane on the syndicated action drama series Baywatch: Hawaii (1999–2001), which was followed by portrayals of Ronon Dex on the Syfy science fiction series [[Stargate: Atlantis]] (2005–2009), and [[Khal Drogo]] in the first two seasons of the HBO fantasy drama series [[Game of Thrones]] (2011–2012). He went on to play the lead roles in the Discovery Channel historical drama series Frontier (2016–2018) and the Apple TV+ science fiction series See (2019–2022).

From 2016 to 2023, Momoa portrayed [[aquaman (dc)|Aquaman]] in the [[DC Extended Universe]] (DCEU), primarily in the films [[Justice League]] (2017), [[aquaman (movie)|Aquaman]] (2018), and Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom (2023), with cameo appearances in other media. Momoa has also played Duncan Idaho in the science fiction film [[dune (series)|Dune]] (2021), and has starred in the action film Fast X (2023).

title: stargate:_atlantis

title: nikaidou_(dorohedoro)
body:
A character from the seinen [i][[Dorohedoro]][/i].

She's [[Caiman (dorohedoro)|]]'s friend, and follows him in his quest of recovering his human face and memories. She's proficient in hand to hand combat.

She prepares Kaiman's trademark favorite [[jiaozi]], and is owner of the restaurant "Hungry Bug".

title: aquaman_(movie)
body: Aquaman is a 2018 American superhero film based on the DC character of the same name. It is the sixth film in the [[DC Extended Universe]] (DCEU). Directed by James Wan from a screenplay by David Leslie Johnson-McGoldrick and Will Beall, it stars [[Jason Momoa]] as Arthur Curry / [[Aquaman (dc)|Aquaman]].

body:
A small transportation device that uses manual pulling force to transport people and/or objects. Popularly associated with arctic travel and [[sledding]].

If pulled by an animal, a sled is commonly pulled by animals like sled dogs. For the larger similar transports pulled by [[horse|horses]] or [[reindeer]], uses the [[sleigh]] tag instead.

title: felicity_jones
body:
Felicity Rose Hadley Jones (born 17 October 1983) is a British actress, and started her professional acting career as a child, appearing in The Treasure Seekers (1996) at age 12. She went on to play Ethel Hallow for one series of the television series The Worst Witch and its sequel Weirdsister College. On radio, she has played the role of Emma Grundy in the BBC's The Archers. In 2008, she appeared in the Donmar Warehouse production of The Chalk Garden.
Since 2006, Jones has appeared in the films Northanger Abbey (2007), Brideshead Revisited (2008), Chéri (2009), The Tempest (2010), [[The Amazing Spider-Man 2]] (2014), and True Story (2015). Her performance in the 2011 film Like Crazy was met with critical acclaim and awards including a special jury prize at the 2011 Sundance Film Festival. Her performance as Jane Hawking in the 2014 biographical film The Theory of Everything earned her nominations for the BAFTA and Academy Award for Best Actress.

In 2016, Jones starred in the adventure-thriller Inferno, the fantasy drama A Monster Calls, and the space opera [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] as [[Jyn Erso]]. She has since portrayed Ruth Bader Ginsburg in the biopic On the Basis of Sex (2018), and has starred in the streaming films The Aeronauts (2019), The Midnight Sky (2020), and The Last Letter from Your Lover (2021).

title: howto:copyright
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Overview":[#dtext-definition]
* "Criteria":[#dtext-criteria]
** "Qualifying Criteria":[#dtext-qualifying-criteria]
** "Disqualifying Criteria":[#dtext-disqualifying-criteria]
* "Guidelines":[#dtext-guides]
* "Return":[#dtext-go-back]
[/expand]

h4#definition. What is the "Copyright" tag in Danbooru?

On Danbooru, the term "copyright" means "the anime/game/comic/movie/etc from which a character originates". [b]It does NOT mean "anything that is copyrighted".[/b]

Posts not based on any established works should be tagged with the [[original]] copyright tag.

If you're unsure if something should be a copyright tag, ask yourself, "Are there characters within this?" If the answer is "no", then leave it as a "General" tag.

h4#criteria. Criteria

h6#qualifying_criteria. What types of things SHOULD be a copyright tag?

Any anime/tv show/game/book/comic/movie, or a company that makes these types of things. Examples: [[K-ON!]], [[House M.D.]], [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]], [[Harry Potter (series)|]], [[Yotsubato!]], [[Gone with the Wind]], [[Nintendo]], [[Kyoto Animation]].

Even [[doujinshi|self-published works]], fan games, etc. should be copyright typed, for example: [[Touhou Musou Kakyou]] (fan anime), [[Narcissu]] (doujinshi), [[Koumajou Densetsu]], and [[Touhou Mother]] (both are fan games).

Vocaloid songs with at least one image on Danbooru also get copyright tags: for example, [[We are Pop Candy! (Vocaloid)]], [[Rolling Girl (Vocaloid)]].  These should all have the "_(vocaloid)" qualifier on the end to allow them to be grouped easily by a {{*_(vocaloid)}} search, and to avoid ambiguity in the case of ones like [[Knife (Vocaloid)]].

[[tag group:pixiv projects|Pixiv projects]] are also considered copyrights: for example, [[Pixiv Fantasia]], [[Pixiv Festa]].

Musical groups are considered to be copyrights as well: [[Kalafina]], [[Iron Maiden (Band)]].

h6#disqualifying_criteria. What types of things SHOULD NOT be a copyright tag?

There are many types of things that, although they are copyrighted, should not be a copyright tag on Danbooru.

For example, these are simply objects, and so should be general tags.

* Models of cars, car brands: e.g. [[Nissan]], [[Toyota Supra]]
* Food and drink brands: e.g.  [[Caloriemate]], [[Coca-cola Zero]], [[Pocky]].
* Gun types: e.g. [[Barrett M82]], [[P90]]

Tags referring to specific stores or their uniforms should also be general: e.g. [[7-eleven]], [[Anna Miller]].

* However, [[McDonald's]] and [[Pepsi]] are considered a copyright since there are characters such as [[Ronald McDonald]] and [[Pepsiman]] originating from them.

Names of songs from anime should be general: e.g. [[Ren'ai Circulation]], [[Minna no Peace]].

Websites can go either way: [[Wikipedia]] has the character [[Wikipe-tan]] and so it is a copyright, the same with [[Pixiv]], which has [[Chobi (pixiv)|]] and [[Pixiv-tan]]. However, websites with no characters, such as [[Yahoo]] or [[Flickr]] should be general.

h4#guides. How to make a copyright tag.

To make a tag be a copyright tag, prefix it with "copyright:" or "copy:". Remember to replace spaces with underscores (like_this).

Copyright tags should be in the original language, for example [[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]], not [[When the Seagulls Cry]]. If the translated title is widely used, you may "request an alias":/tag_alias_request/new from that to the original language title.

* Note: There are some "grandfathered-in" exceptions to this rule, including [[Spice and Wolf]], [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], and [[Fullmetal Alchemist]].
* The [[Fatal Frame]] series is also an exception since the original name is the ambiguous word "Zero".
* If there is official romanization of a copyright tag, it will automatically grandfather the tag. Example: [[Azumanga Daioh]] over Azumanga Daiou, [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] over Yuu-Gi-Ou.
** See forum #168087 for details.
** By default it is partial grandfathering since it is copyright tags which is affected unless there is an attempt to completely grandfather the copyright tag (copyright tags and character tags using English/North American names).
* [[Pokemon]] tags were formerly partly grandfathered-in, as of topic #17160, they are now completely grandfathered-in copyright tags.

If the copyright name includes a subtitle, this may be omitted from the tag name. For example, the tag for "Planetarian ~Chiisana Hoshi no Yume~" is simply [[planetarian]] and "Koihime † Musou ~Doki ☆ Otome Darake no Sangokushi Engi~" becomes [[koihime_musou]]. Similarly, if the original title is the same or similar phrase in two languages, e.g. 銀の匙 Silver Spoon, or 幼なじみは大統領 My girlfriend is the PRESIDENT, you may omit the second part.

Please follow [[howto:romanize|Danbooru's Romanization Guidelines]]. Do not include symbols such as ☆ † ♪ ♥. Do include any punctuation such as ! & + ? . (Please note that the comma, the asterisk, and the percent sign cannot be used in tags.) Replace × with the letter "x".

If you are unsure how to romanize the copyright name, ask in a comment or on the forum.

Do not use a fan-created title to [b]bypass or circumvent two-tag search[/b], such as [[Suzumiya Haruhiko no Yuuutsu]] for {{suzumiya_haruhi_no_yuuutsu genderswap}}.

h4#go_back. Go Back

* "Return to Tags and Sources":/wiki_pages/help:toc.html#dtext-tags_and_sources
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: mother_and_child
body:
Posts depicting a relationship of mother and child, where it either cannot be determined that the child is a [[mother and daughter|daughter]] or a [[mother and daughter|son]], or it is not warranted.

There are two identifiable criteria for this:

* the child is of indeterminate or no gender, or
* the characters depicted are not actually related as such by birth or adoption, and are merely imitating such a relationship.

h4. Other family tags

* [[Father and child]]
* [[Father and daughter]]
* [[Father and son]]

title: mother_and_son
body:
Posts showing a mother and her son. It can be one of two identifiable things:

* A young boy (child or teen) and an [[mature female|older woman]] (at least middle-aged) side-by-side, or
* Two characters from a named series known to be mother and son.

h4. See also
* [[Mother and daughter]]
* [[Mother and child]]
* [[tag group:family relationships]]
